text: 2011 bottle @ The Globe Hong Kong. Pours dark muddy slightly reddish brown with medium cream colored head. Aroma is roasty dark malt, tobacco, dried oak, leather, muted red berries, slight smokiness on the finish. Taste is likewise - rich, smooth, creamy mouthfeel, more chocolate shows here, loads of oaky barrel notes.

Fra flaske 2009-utg. p√• Mi2 (sommeravslutning) p√• Cardinal juni-17: brunsvart med ok skum. Mild, rund, uhyre smaksrik og lekkert balansert med m√∏rke frukter, m√∏rk kandis, sjokolade og alle godsakene fra t√∏rkede frukter. Vitamininnholdet merkes ikke f√∏r man reiser seg. Kveldens beste (sammen med Prairie/Evil Twin Bible Belt BA). 7-3-9-5-17.

0,33l bottle at home. Vintage 2011. Bottled 15.03.2016. dark brown color, small tan head. smells ripe fruits, light joghurt, tobacco, light brown sugar. nice smell overall. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of ripe fruits, some fruit notes, brown sugar, berry notes, nutty, marzipan. finishes lightly sweet with notes of berry notes, ripe fruits and some sugar. nice one overall, rather heavy but also rather drinkable. maybe not as good as the score would suggest.

W aromacie klasyka trapist√≥w do tego nuty beczki, drewno, suszone owoce. W smaku r√≥wnie≈º nuty beczkowe piƒôknie uzupe≈ÇniajƒÖ abbota. Rewelacja, pi≈Çem tu≈º po westvletteren 12 i moim zdaniem co najmniej klasa wy≈ºej.

2010 bottle. Appearance is very dark brown, almost black, a fizzy light brown head which quickly vanishes. Aroma- booze, port wine, plum, dates, cherries, chocolate malt, hint of vanilla, Christmas pudding, rich fruit cake, red wine, bit of coffee in the background. Taste- chocolate, sugary raisin, fruit cake, nutty malt, oaky undertones, leathery malt, booze dark fruit, cherry skins, vinous notes, woody earthy finish. Sweet sugary fruit. Full and clingy and rich mouthfeel. Loads going on- superb.

Not a good experience with the 2005 bottles. Two out of three just exploded on opening. The third bottle however was a success. Slightly better than the normal version, woody taste strong alcohol aftertaste. 
2007 version much better and less expensive.

Suutuntuma on l√§mmitt√§v√§n alkoholinen ja melko t√§ytel√§inen, lopussa alkoholi polttaa ehk√§ hieman liikaa, muuten olisi t√§ysi vitonen. T√§ytel√§inen, monimuotoinen, tuhti ja todellinen klassikko. Vaikka aromeja sek√§ tuoksussa ett√§ maussa on paljon, ne t√§ydent√§v√§t loistavasti toisiaan nostaen oluen entist√§ korkeammalle. T√§ydellinen valinta 1000. arvioksi ja top 10-kamaa itselleni ehdottomasti. Pannepot joka muodossa on toiminut minulle.

330 ml bottle into chalice, 2011 vintage bottling. Pours moderately hazy/cloudy very dark reddish brown color with a 1 finger dense khaki head with great retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big raisin, plum, cherry, fig, date, apricot, apple, berry, red grape, caramel, brown sugar, toffee, brown bread, toasted biscuit, nuttiness, and oak; with lighter notes of chocolate, cocoa, molasses, clove, vanilla, herbal, and yeast/toasted earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of dark/bready/light roasted malt, fruity yeast, and moderate oak notes; with great strength. Taste of big raisin, plum, cherry, fig, date, apricot, apple, berry, red grape, caramel, brown sugar, toffee, brown bread, toasted biscuit, nuttiness, and oak; with lighter notes of chocolate, cocoa, molasses, clove, vanilla, herbal, and yeast/toasted earthiness. Light yeast spiciness and herbal/roast bitterness on the finish. Lingering notes of dark fruit, cherry, apricot, apple, berry, red grape, caramel, brown sugar, toffee, brown bread, toasted biscuit, nuttiness, oak, light chocolate/cocoa/molasses, herbal, yeast/toasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/bready/light roasted malt, fruity yeast, and moderate oak flavors; with a great malt/bitter/spiciness balance, and zero cloying sweetness after the finish. Light dryness from bitter/spiciness, lightly increasing through the glass. Medium carbonation and medium-full body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/bready/grainy, and slightly sticky/chalky/tannic balanced mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol for 10%. Overall this is an incredible oak aged Quadrupel style. All around fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/bready/light roasted malt, fruity yeast, and moderate oak flavors; very smooth and easy to drink for the big ABV. Incredible yeast/malt complexity in perfect balance; nice oak presence that is never overwhelming, tannic, or drying. A highly enjoyable offering.
Pours dark brown, hazy, small head. Fruits, molassess, wood, roasty, dry cherries, plum. Sweet, little dry. Full body, rund taste, lively.

Dark brown with a hazy tone. Small creamy beige head. Carbonation medium to high. Notes of dried fruits, vanilla, wood, plums and malt caramel. The sweet presence it¬ís felt slightly in the begging. I like this beer because of the complexity. You can discover with every sip how well are the ingredients used and blend together in the begging with a small sweetness from dried fruits and in the end with the bitterness of hop and oak wood. Alcohol plays a nice role in the background. 

Bottle of 330 ml vintage 2011.

2010 vintage. Bottle from Stirchley Wines for my birthday months ago, but too drunk to appreciate. So tonight¬ís the night.  Very dark brown beer with residual head. Light carbonation. Aroma of treacle, toffee, brown sugar and dark malts. Taste is licorice, dark malts, treacle, prunes, brown sugar, some brandy and booze. Medium to full bodied and sticky on the palate. Excellent.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: 330ml bottle from BeerShop.com.ua. Vintage 2011. Pours a very dark brown with a dark beige head. Aroma is dark fruits, brown sugar. Similar taste with chocolate and oak notes. Good stuff.

Bottle (Pannepot Grand Reserva 2011). Hazy brown colour, rocky beige head, good lacing. Strong, rich aroma of apples, prunes, raisins, molasses, caramel, dried fruits. Taste is medium to heavy sweet, light bitter, caramel, molasses, lots of apples, pears, prunes, raisins, light fruity tartness, some wood. Rather woody and slightly alcoholic finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is average. Outstanding and elegant beer, even more complex than regular Pannepot, with Calvados barrel really adding a lot to it.

Bottle, Vintage 2011. Pours dark brown with medium tan head. No strong aroma. Plum, wood and leather flavors, slightly sour. Viscous mouthfeel. Very nice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, vintage 2011. Dark brown with beige head. Aromas of dried fruits, some roasted malts, hints of sourness. Taste is lightly sour, a bit sweet, with slightly bitter finish. Subtle woody aftertaste. A bit below my expectations.

Dark murky mahogany. Aroma is raisin and vanilla. Palate is chewy. This beer is delicous

Rating 3,200. 330 mL bottle shared by ebone1988 for the 1700/3200 rating thing. Vintage 2011. The pour is a darker brown with some light ruby shining through and a bubbly film of dark khaki colored head and a couple spots of lace. The aroma is nice. There is a nice dark chocolate and fruitiness about it with a great maltiness and a sweet caramel. The oak is nice and present but the Calvados really balances it out. I really like this. The flavor is good as well. There is a strong dark caramel and fruitiness the oak is strong and present with a distinct brandy and light apple addition. The mouth feel is light and clean with a nice clsofter carbonation and a lingeringly fruity oak and brandy finish. This is really good. I like this one a lot better than the regular Reserva.

#1700. Bottle shared with koleminer20 for his #3200. Vintage 2011. Aroma is sweet, caramel, dark fruit, apple brandy, barrel, slight booze, toffee, awesome. Appearance is brown red, light broken head, pretty hazy. Taste is dark fruit, caramel, apple brandy, barrel, toffee, complex and great. Mouthfeel is medium body, light carbonation, dry dark fruit and Apple brandy barrel aftertaste. Overall, this one is really great.
2011 vintage, 33cl bottle purchased @ La caisse de bi√®re. Belle rondeur avec quelques notes de fruits comme la prune.

@ Budapest. 

Chestnut brown with a medium sized beige head with good regeneration. Rich nose with toffee, dark dried fruits, brown sugar, honey and cocoa. Flavour has cocoa, dark dried fruits, brown sugar, molasses and spices. Full body, lively carbonation, medium sweet and bitter, light acidic. Long finish with dark fruits.

2011 vintage bottle from Pivoljub. Well balanced and pleasant. Low acidity, low molassess, caramel, vanilla, spices.

UPDATED: MAR 10, 2017 Muddy brown, small beige head. Powerful esters on nose. Caramel, oak, spicy yeast. Medium body. Vinous taste. Medium dry. Lots of dried fruit. Prune. Tannins. Low bitterness. As expected very good. Yet not as impressive as regular Reserva.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle. Dark brown with a medium tan head. The complexity of this velvetty smooth aroma is undescribable. The spices and dried fruits and malts all blend into one invisible vortex of scents and flavors that sucks you in and in and in and... then you take another gulp. Truly amazing.

Dark brown body. Not that much head. Wineous and alcohol nose. Fruit, cherry, coffee, wine, liquorice flavour. Some bread. Quite bitter, with a lot of sweetness as well. Hint of sour. Thick, oily body. Soft carbonation. Good, but maybe a bit too much flavour from the barrels in my opinion.

33cl bottle at home. Appearance: chestnut brown with medium beige head. Aroma: red fruits, plums, roasted malts, vanilla, calvados, oak, caramel. Taste: high sweetness and medium bitterness. some slight acidity. Notes of red fruits, grape, vanilla, oak, spices, cinnamon. Palate: medium bodied, oily yet sticky texture and soft carbonation.

12oz bottle. Dark plum color with an offf white head. Spicy dark fruit aroma. Spicy plum dark fruit toffee flavour with a sticky sweet finish. Heavy body. A lot of complexity.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at Cambrinus in Bruges with commonshawn, rosskyle, samalito, and dubtully. 2012 edition. Quickly dissipating head on a deep, dark brown ale. Heavy cloudy nature. Nose is assertive and leads you to believe it?s big on alcohol. Dark fruit is very prevalent. Maybe a hint of chocolate. Taste has plenty of chocolate and a healthy dark fruit balance. Sweetness present. Mouthfeel is silky and smooth. Hard to find the alcohol which could prove dangerous. This is what Surly Darkness wishes it could be on its best day. Exceedingly drinkable and instantly makes me want another.

2011 bottle, consumed at home. Pours very dark cola brown with a fizzy beige head that leaves a bit of lacing. Aroma of caramel, prunes, spices. A little bit boozy. Taste is slightly bitter with burnt caramel, roast, chocolate, liquorice and some dried dark fruit.

Appearance: dark reddish-brown, tan lasting foam, lasts. Aroma: malt, alcohol, toasty. Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour. Palate: medium body, creamy, average carbonation, astringent, long finish,medium bitter, salty.

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2017 2011 8/5/8/5/16 clear redish brown liquid with tan head. Aroma of caramel, alcohol, bread, dryed plum. Tastes same, medium+ sweet, light bitter, light sour. Full body, creamy feel, average carb
2012 8/4/7/5/15 clear brown loquid with fast disappearing tan head. Aroma of alcohol, bread, chocolate, plum, rye. Tastes same, medium sweet, light bitter, light sour. Full body, creamy feel, average carb, astringent, long fin

Medium/strong, soft aroma with dark fruits like plum and cherry, some licorice. Dark red color with no head. Strong, soft, balanced taste with raisin, cherry, some licorice. You really can taste the softness and maturity. Medium taste spectrum and medium aftertaste with plum. Medium/light body with medium carbonation. Overall, superb, almost too soft and matured which also affects negatively to its distinctive character.

Bottle from Brewcraft, drank at home. Pours an opaque dark brown with thin fizzy beige head. Smells of dark fruits, plenty of figs, plum, apricot, moderately raisiny, bready malt, nutmeg, cinnamon, brown sugar, lots of warm booze, nice deep leathery note, tiny bit of mushroom, light stony/mineral bitterness, thick and aged with a plum/fig tartness. Taste is burnt roasted dark malt, sharp dried fruit tartness, lightly bitter herbalness, very sharp finish - a bit thin compared to the nose. Body is very smooth, a bit acidic, faintly chalky, dissipates delicately. Aroma is rich and complex, a bit raisiny. Big and boozy but still manages to be fine/delicate.

Bottle from Brewcraft at home. Opaque dark cola brown with bubbly dissipating head. Aroma is sharp with boozy wood with vanilla, leather, and dry dark fruit. Aging definitely noticeable. Taste is sharp again, booze, dark fruit and raisin, some savoriness. Taste is complex but a bit too much maybe. Body is rich but slightly chalky. Big interesting beer but probably wouldn¬ít get again.

Grand reserva 2011. Pours nut brown with medium beige head. Aroma is peanuts, caramel, butterscotch, spices, some cinnamon, brown sugar, raisin. Taste is caramel, almond, roasted peanuts, some oil, a bit sourish, black currant, wooden, berries. Very nice beer!
33 cl bottle, Grand reserva 2011. Dark Brown, nice. Raisins, spices, prune, dark fruit. Nice solid mouthfeel, I like pannepot in all its forms.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupe≈Çniania profilu na ratebeer. Wybitny quadrupel. Suszone owoce, figi, rodzynki, kawa, czekolada, delikatna kwasowo≈õƒá. Wybitne.

Color marr√≥n muy oscuro casi negro, opaco, con capa de espuma marr√≥n de dos dedos de grosor (retenci√≥n decente). Carbonataci√≥n media. Aroma complej√≠simo: dominado por el alcohol, mucha madera, dark fruits, un toque de caf√©, vainilla, alguna especia... Ojal√° fuera capaz de listar todo lo que hay en esta cerveza. Sabor que me recuerda mucho a la Rochefort 10 (misma fruta, indudable), con mayor carga alcoh√≥lica, mucha madera, caramelo, vainilla ¬øcanela? El postgusto es verdaderamente potente y √∫nico: queda fruta, algo especiado y un toque lejano de caf√© en el paladar (y dura, y dura, y dura...). Si bien el alcohol est√° muy presente tanto en aroma como en sabor, dir√≠a que est√° mejor sintetizado que en la Pannepot original. Ideal para tardes lluviosas de baja temperatura. Aunque yo la tomar√≠a hasta para desayunar.

2011 vintage. This is barrel aged and has a double digit ABV, but it still comes across as restrained, even a bit dull. There¬ís some flavor from the barrels, but it¬ís light, and the dominant tastes are toast, fruit, and some hop bitterness at the end. I think this might be getting a little old -- the flavors were muted, and I think I¬íd give the nod to the other, younger Pannepots that I¬íve had.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2017 2011 edition, 33cl bottle at home from Beers of Belgium, Antwerp. Nose is dried fruits, perfume, old wood. Body is black, head is medium, beige, creamy, average lasting, good lacing. Aroma is dried fruits, chocolate liquor, roasted malt, molasses, herbs. Medium sweet, medium bitter, light to medium fruity sour. Finish is medium lasting fruity roasty medium bittersweet, medium alcohol warmth. Full body, oily texture, average carbonation. Bit heavy, strong flavor, well balanced, nice one.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2017 33 cl bottle (vintage 2010), served in snifter. Poured dark brown with a small tan head that dissipated instantly. Soft, almost no carbonation. Aroma: figs, plums, raisins, apricots, brown sugar, roasted malts. Taste: plums, raisins, dates, some granny smith apples, chocolate, roasted coffee beans, licorice, dark fruit, roasted nuts, fudge, toffee. Very good, reminds me of the Rochefort family. I¬ím not sure if it is better than the standard Pannepot or the Pannepot Reserva though. I would have to do a side by side tasting but I think that the Pannepot Reserva stays my personal favourite while tasting this beer. It¬ís very good...but in my experience not as good as it¬ís brothers. Could it be the Calvados? Or is it my bottle?Because I get a very flat, almost no carbonation at all. Have to give this beer another go... Anyway it¬ís still a great beer with a very complex, malty and fruity character. Medium to full body with a very creamy fruity, bittersweet finish.
Bottle - 2011 - just like a high octane scotch ale - sweet malt, light fruitcake - very easy drinking considering the abv - excellent.

2011 vintage. Beautifully complex brew. Liquor type aroma with figs, dark dried fruits, some spice. Same in the flavor but with rich dark maltiness and chocolate. Great beer to start out the new year!
Zoet, licht bitter. Mout, suiker, alcohol, overrijp fruit. Bijna zwart van kleur. Volle body.

Bottle. Vintage 2011. Dark brown with tan head. Heavy malty and light hoppy. Aroma of caramel, overriped fruits, dried fruits, figs, apples with wooden notes. Yesty esters. Complex. Starts heavy sweet turns light sour and finish light bitter with lingering alocholic notes. Nice Balanced. Medium body and juicy texture. Lively carbonation. A Great one

Vintage 2010. Pours very dark brown, almost close to black, with a quickly dissipating dark brown head. Aroma is extremely rich, probably one of the richest I¬íve had with coffee, nuts, honey, vanilla, brown sugar, leaves, red berries, plums, alcohol, oak, oxidated notes. Taste is medium to fully sweet, with big malty flavours, dark dried fruit, blueberries, oakiness, alcohol. Along this sweet tone there is a slight sour note in between which balances it out nicely. Medium to big body, medium carbo, oily mouthfeel. This is close to perfection.

Vintage 2011. 33 cl bottle served at room temperature (18-20¬∫ C) in La Trappe chalice, which I think suits this ale better than Struise ones (imho). Pours darkest brown, almost tar black. Moka-coloured head lasts less than the blink of an eye. This beer has the strongest aromatic intensity I have ever come across in my experience: you can tell one scent from other being half metre away from the glass, honest. berries (blackberry, blackcurrant, bilberry), raisins, vanilla, black chocolate, tobacco, black pepper, soy sauce, coffee, shiitake mushrooms, leather... Honest! Not making this up at all, everything is there. Now, for the final act: taste is powerful, wide, still fizzy (more than five years have gone by). Oily mouthfeel, with an incredible umami and sour taste all through the tongue. No bitterness whatsoever, nor even in the long -very long finish. Amazing (and sure it will improve over time). Cannot wait to get the next one.

F: medium size, pale brown, average retention.
C: dark brown to dark, opaque.
A: malt, chocolate, woody, apple, plums, molasses, dates, dark fruits, candy, light cocoa, leather.
T: malt, dark fruits, dark cherries, light apple, dates, candy, hint of woody, vanilla, leather, tobacco, warming alcohol, complex, good balanced and suitable for special evening like today is, worth to try, Vintage 2011, 33cl bottle cca 3,2¬Ä from Prik&Tik Kampenhout.

Vintage 2011
Donker bruin tot een zwarte kleur. Aroma doet me denken aan een stout. Verder krijg ik drop uit het aroma. Smaak is een mix tussen een stout en quadrupel. Smaak ebt snel weg na je hem doorslikt.

Eines der wundervollsten und zugleich g√∂tternahen Getr√§nke, welches jemals meinen Gaumen veredeln durfte. Unfassbar!!! So sollte Whisky schmecken. Holzig, beerig und von einer elegant samtigen Textur begleitet, nimmt der unwiderstehlich komplexe Strong Barrel Aged Wahn seinen Lauf. Man m√∂chte kistenweise von dieser, sp√§ter wahnwitzig kirschigen, Versuchung erheischen und einlagern. Das Finale ist unendlich hopfig, dabei klar w√§rmend alkoholisch und malzig verspielt. Yeah!!! Sie extreme S√§ure des Originals wurde formvollendet vergentlemaned. 0,33/ca.4¬Ä. Bottle. Finestbelgianbeer Webshop. Vintage 2011. Am besten ungesudet vernaschen... üòÅ.

Vintage 2011. Negra opaca, espuma beige, efervescente, que desaparece al instante, dejando cerco. Aroma lic√≥rico, madera, y a chicle. En boca tiene un paso moderadamente ligero, con gas presente. Compleja de sabor, co√±ac, chocolate, frutos secos, frutas rojas, madera. Gran cuerpo, muy redondo y lic√≥rico. Final cal√≥rico, alcoh√≥lico.

Draft 2012 0.15l at De Struise Brouwers tap takeover Craft&Draft Amsterdam, The Netherlands. 19.11.2016. Pour it dark color with no head. Aroma caramel sugary feel, red wine, oaky, woody. Taste earthy, toast, cheese, licorice, skunky, vanilla, woody, candy sugar, tart just a pinch, red wine feel, balsamic vinegar at the end, medium sweetness, lightly sour, full body, sticky, soft carbonation, long finish. Nice
2011, Kolor burgundowy, w aromacie suszone owoce, wi≈õnie, nieco taninowe i drewniane. W smaku podobnie - alkohol lekko wyczuwalny, ≈õwietnie zbalansowane i u≈Ço≈ºone.

Bottle, 2011. Pours dark, brownish with a bit of mahogany or chestnut. Head¬ís small, beige, retains as scattered film and around the edge. Aroma... real nice, deep, caramel and dark fruits, wood, the apples from Calvados are definitely there. Tastes caramelly sweet, dark dried fruits, a bit of red wine and hints of Calvados. Woody dry finish. Very good, especially the aroma, but overall it left me unsatisfied, considering the hype.

Caramel rietsuiker aroma. Knapperig sprankelend met een caramel kleurig schuimkraag die snel weg trekt. De wat zwaardere diepere pannepot combinatie! Sprankelend in de mond prikkelend in de afdronk diep en complex met hinten van cognac een gerookter bier. Een prachtig mooi samengeweven complex geheel dat minder lang als een de andere pannepotten blijft plakken. Voor mij persoonlijk zijn de reserva en de gewone pannepot beter. Maar ook dit blijft gewoonweg geniaal!

Bottled, 330ml, vintage 2005 from my Anniversary collection given by Sandra sourced by Fin, cheers all. Bordeaux wine colour with only slight head. This is really full on the palate, loads going on, initially there is a tartness, fruity with a hint of cherry also quite woody, tarry. The alcohol is well disguised within the beer, no rough edges, hints of sweeter caramel, smooth. A world class beer.

33cl-fles van bij Tabac&Co - Palais des bi√®res te Dottenijs (in Famiflora). U: Bijna zwart met bruine schuimkraag. G: Geroosterde mout, chocolade, calvados, alcohol, mout en wat kruidigheid. S: Bitterzoet, geroosterde chocolade, donker fruit, alcohol en wat kruidigheid. M: Volmondig met medium carbonatie.

Vintage 2011. Net als de reguliere Pannepot heel erg lekker. Alleen had ik van deze nog iets extra¬ís verwacht. Ik kan echter niet veel verschil met de gewone Pannepot ontdekken en vind deze zelfs nog net iets minder uitgesproken.

0.33 l, 2011, dark garnet color. Great aroma: esters, old strong wine, dried dark fruits, caramel, toffee, a bit spicy and light smoked oak. Rich taste: good stron alco, oak, toffee, dark malts, old port, vanilla, warming and very pleasant.

2011 vintage. Bubblegum, dried figs, dried cherries, chocolate, caramel, oak, red apple, light star anise, light allspice/clove. Nice apple juiciness still present in the taste. A Belgian strong ale which has likely toned down some of its generous spiciness and yeastiness over time to present itself with utmost refinement. Reminiscent of a beautiful woman selecting the finest attire to attain the peak of her elegance.

2011 bottle purchased at Crafted Drafts. Pours clear reddish brown with a thick tan head. Aroma of malt, banana, candied raisins, oak and spice. Malty and caramelly flavor giving way to spice and candied fruit before a light oak finish.

Robe presque noire avec des reflets roux. Col fin beige, tr?s faible tenue. Nez alcooleux, de prunes, fruits secs, malt grill? l?ger. Bottle.
Dark reddish-brwon, nice head. Aroma: oak, vanilla, dark berries, caramel. Taste: sweet, sourish notes, vanilla, wood, toffee. Well balanced. Very nice!

Pours a clear, very deep brown body with a small, light-brown head that leaves some lacing. Very strong aroma of dark caramel, pleasant Belgian yeast, dark dried fruits, roasted malt, fortified wine and wood, and some gentle vanilla and faint fermented apples in the back. 330 ml ¬ì2011¬î bottle bought at HK Brewcraft in Central.
Looks: Clear deep brownish black with a layer of dirt-like yeast sedimentsOne-quarter finger head with soapy light beige foam which fades in 40 seconds; Fair sticky lacing with near zero carbonation.

Aroma: Very fragrant rich dark malt, with strong caramel, toffee, rum, strong raisins, dark fruits, coffee, cream, cane sugar, nice oak barrel, cidery apples, strong Bel yeast and grass. Complex and nice! 

Taste: Mid to strong sweet full dark malt, with fairly strong rum-like alcohol, liquorices, strong caramel, light toffee, dark fruits, floral, brown sugar, wood barrel, strong Bel yeast, spices, herbs, lemon, mid to strong bitter hops and grass.

<pBody: Full body. Quite thick and creamy palate.

Mouth Feel: Wholesome dark maltyness in a somewhat watery but very slick background. Smooth and quite creamy. Nice rum booze set the tune, back with tasty oak barrel to showcase strong dark fruits, caramel, floral and brown sugar. Notable herbs and fair spices. Moderate lemon to round. Comfy and nice!

Hoppiness: Grass in nose. Floral, herbs, lemon and grass in taste;
Bitterness is mostly liquorice for an abrupt, mid astringent sweet-malty finish.

After Taste: Fairly dry. Nice sweet and fair liquor bitter to mouth.

Comments: Compares to the original Struise Pannepot, this one has the nice cidery oak barrel aroma and subtle, very well-presented rum and barrel taste, at the expense of rich maltyness and dark fruity characters. It¬ís a ¬ëlevel-up¬í in some way, but not as mind-bending as I expected. Glad I¬íve tried this one, but I still preferred the rich Struise Pannepot original.

P.S.: A nice one to for my 1600th rating!

Dark copper with a thick tan head. Sticky syrupy sweet aroma. Soft texture. Roast meets sweet malty subdued flavor with a touch of barrel character. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
33cl @home , bijna zwart van kleur met snel verdwijnende schuimkraag. Vol van smaak , porto , rozijnen , rood fruit. Topper  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
Black liquid with brown foam. Very fruity aroma. Sweet with nice bitterness

2011. Dark brown, 1 cm tan head. Aroma stewed dark fruit, apples, bread, oak. The apples are fine but obscure much of the depth of the Reserva. Creamy texture that¬ís full but nimble and alive. The Calvados is back in the mix in the taste and matches OK with the old aleish dried and stewed fruit, bread and leather. An interfering complication to the normal version (whereas the Reserva I found sympathetically resonant). But still a very good beer.

2008 bottle. Pour is deep murky brown with a short lived effervescent head. Some floaties in there too. Aroma is big toffee malt with dark fruit and brown sugar. A hint of brandy as well. Flavor is true to nose with rich toffee malt and some dried fruit. Sweet but not cloying. Earthy depth with a light woody and nutty finish. No oxidation to speak of. Lingering brown sugar. Tasty stuff.
2009: Cocoa, tobacco, walnut, raisin nose. Cloudy brown, thin tan head. Raisin, walnut. Medium body, moderate carbonation.

Bottle, vintage 2005. Pure black, smells like soy sauce and lots of weird dark fruit ferment, prunes. Palate is very smooth like a velvety oil, alcohol is no burn but you can taste its texture and presence, very complex flavour with a slight sweetness, a bit of a brandy character, some light licorice. Really great!
Bottle. Vintage 2010. Dried fruit and dark berries. Hints of liquorice. Dry, oaked red wine. Herbs.

Bottle from Dranken Verheyen in Poppel. The beer is hazy dark brown to black colored and has a creamy head, with nice carbonation
The aroma is very malty and soft spicy with also notes of dried fruits and caramel and some cacao is noticable, a little imperial stout like.
The taste is full bodied and sweet with hints of caramel and dark fruits, and changes into a light bitterness with notes of cacao, spices, coffee and some refreshing hop and some hidden alcohol in the background.
The finish is warming alcohol, light bitter and very long. 
Loved it!
2011 vintage. Pours deep mahogany with no head. Whilst undeniably a fine brew, this fails to live up to the hype for me, as did the standard version. Good, but there¬ís much better.
Thanks to the Duke of Garden City Beer Club, Sir Jon, via Brother Paul, this 2010 version is wonderfully perfect.

Ruby-brown, very small head, quite high carbonation. Aroma: cherries, caramel, wet wood, raisins, dark fruits. Heavy sweetness, flavour: dark fruits, apples, lots of wood notes. Tart, tannic finish with lots of alcohol.

Vintage 2011. Uit de fles geschonken. Mooi donkerbruin bier met lichte schuimkraag. Aroma is kruidig met gedroogd fruit. De smaak is een stuk complexer: mout, gedroogd fruit, rood fruit, kruiden. Een volle rijke smaak met een heerlijke afdronk. Mooi zoet bier. Topper!

Vintage 2011. Copper clear color with ruby reflections. Beer looks for massively over carbonated since it developed huge, nonpersistent beige head. Aromat is sweet, fruity, raisins, plums, port wine, apples and a touch of alcohol. Beauity full aroma, but might be a bit more intense. Taste follows the aroma. Alcohol, dark fruits and spices, dark ebony with a very persistant and creamy beige head, medium body, law carbonation, oily, chocolate, dark fruits and alcohol, like a liqueur wine...there is no egg in this beer but many fishermans today can enjoy this perfect beer.

Dark wood coloured, though little head and no lacing. Body is full and smooth with some gentle underlying carbonation. Complex, well balanced and very drinkable. Dried fruit, dark malt, nuts, banana cake, plums, star anise, brown sugar, caramel, port. Great.

33cl bottle. Dark ruby-brown pour with a thin tan head. Smells like caramel, raisins and other dried fruit, a bit of chocolate. The taste follows the same notes, with additional milk coffee, nuts and spices. Medium to full bodied, medium carbonation and a sticky, spicy aftertaste. Quite complex yet very well balanced.

Acquired via trade with Chopz. BB 04/05/19. PNP No.4 vintage 2009. 330ml bottle. Pours a fair size frothy beige head that dissipates to a thin coating. Has a dark murky brownish appearance with sediments quite visible. Lacing is a bit weak. Aromas are strong spice, yeast, coffee and dried type fruits. Flavours are in the same vein but much more varied it¬ís quite crazy. Lots of different flavours at various points like chocolate, raisins, figs, dates, strong spice notes. Coffee in the finish. Smooth and creamy mouthfeel. Slick and drying sensation as well as a nice warming sensation the longer it sits. At 10%abv, very well hidden. Quite easy to drink actually. Pretty good stuff!

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2016 2011 edition. Strong wooden, earthy, liquorice, old grapes, chocolate, red fruits and a bit alcoholic aroma. Nice brown colour with an off-white head, but fastfood vanishing. Aftertaste is a bit dry and includes chocolate, oak, fruits and malts. Really great!

Tap. Pours brown blackish with a tan head. Aroma of raisins, dark fruits, lots of caramel, roasted notes, strong in every aspect. Taste is very sweet, lots of dark fruits followed by plum and deep caramel. Sticky and a sipper.
Vintage 2011. Unclear dark brown. Thin tan head. Layers upon layers of complexity make each sip a pleasure. A very harmonious creation. Quite unique as well. No booze. Great sipper.
Brown sugar, sweet caramel aroma and taste. Dark fruit. Strong and beautiful. Slightly dry finish, but just slight.

Aroma is caramel, alcohol, lots of sugar and wood. Color is pure dark brown, small tanned head. Taste is superb, pretty sweet, heavy hops... excellent.
Full body, pretty smooth and thin texture, low carbonation. Overall... one of the best Belgian Strong Ales.

0.33 l bottle from ¬íThe Beer Tree¬í, 2010 vintage, bottled in November 2014. Clear, very dark ruby with a medium large, frothy, slowly diminishing, tan to light brown head. Sweetish, fruity, a little spicy and slightly boozy aroma of raisins, plums, caramel, cinnamon, marzipan, clove, overripe banana, apples (calvados) and oak. Sweet-malty, slightly sourish-fruity and a little spicy taste of raisins, plums, caramel, overripe banana, chocolate, marzipan, cinnamon, clove, apples (calvados) and some oak, followed by a medium long, slightly bitter, sourish, moderately yeasty-spicy and minimally warming finish. Medium to full body, creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Nicely balanced, very interesting barrel notes, very complex and drinks way too easy. Absolutely delicious!

A black body with mahogany frame sits beneath a fading, frothy, khaki head

Medium plus intensity with very smooth transitions and a touch of Belgian and spirit spice, creamy layers of chocolate covered blueberries & blackberries, dates, caramel & brown sugar with a balanced, silky, intwined cognac influence on a slick yet soft, frothy, creamy medium body... residuals echo the aromas and flavors with notions of cherry cordial

Capped 11.2 FL OZ 2010 Vintage served at 55¬∞ into Orrefors Difference Porter Snifter

Bottle sample at a tasting. Thanks Yoav. 2010 edition. Reddish-brown with nice beige head. Aroma of prunes, wood, raisins, caramel and alcohol. Sweet malt, raisins, caramel, honey, vanilla, port wine, wood, spices, rich and complex flavors. Medium-full bodied, oily and smooth. Very good.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Yoav¬ís place. Thanks Yoav. 2010 vintage. Deep amber with big bubbly brownish head. Sweetish aroma with notes of prune, raisin, date honey and coconut. Very sweet flavor, a bit salty with notes of prune, raisin and lots of wood, a bit alcoholic. Sticky texture, full-bodied. Very nice.

Bottle bought at Willems en Zoon Grobbendonk.
Pours black with a medium beige/brown head. Red wine, port, caramel, malts, dried fruit, wood, tannine, nuts, bread, warm alcoholic feeling, raisins...
How wonderful! Enjoy a beer like this is priceless. Maybe it needed a little gas but other delights, a game of sensations, a beer with a fantastic job.

Shared bottle, provenance unknown, as sucks. Hazy dark brackish brown with minimal head. Nose is like a Quad, with the dark figgy fruit, red wine, yeasty funk, caramel, toffee. Tastes rich, dense, delicious, with layered dark fruit, fig, berry, caramel, yeast, oak, tannins, funk, spice, and a super complex finish. This one is outstanding.

bottle vintage 2010
black sugar aroma , black color, Sweet & Malty ,coffee chocolate
little spice & sour

Bottiglia da 33cl. 
Molto scura, con sfumature rosse, schiuma poco persistente. Al naso inebrianti note di caff√®, torrone, cacao, frutta scura; poi un leggero erbaceo a bilanciare le note finali di whisky e rum affinati in botte. L¬íentrata in bocca √® decisa ma morbida; il malto tostato conferisce leggere note di pane integrale, con vaniglia, frutta secca e scura e caff√® a fare da contorno; chiude leggermente alcolica, con un lungo e piacevole finale amaro, che combina luppolo e malto. Molto corposa. L¬íadeguata carbonatazione rende la bevuta ancora pi√π viva e interessante di quanto sia gi√†. Birra con grande equilibrio, struttura e complessit√†.

Dark brown to black colored, small tan head, not very lasting. Aroma is of brown sugar, molasses, raisins, bit honey, light vinous, oaky, bit booze. Taste is medium+ sweet brown sugar, molasses, dark fruits, raisin mostly, chocolate, oak barrel, light vinous, some spice, some alcohol but mostly well hidden. Full bodied, soft carbonation, sticky syrupy. Real sipping material!
(2010 bottle, Bierhalle Deconinck, Vichte)

Aroma: Caramel, dark fruits, brown sugar, chocolate, coffee, roasted malts. 
Appearance: Dark brown to black, tan 1-finger head. 
Taste: Medium sweet, light bitter, very complex, very balanced. 
Palate: Full body, creamy slick texture, soft carbonation, long sweet finish. 
Overall: Basically the same as ordinary version of Pannepot and Reserva version, the "worst" of this trinity in my opinion.

Bottle from Struise brewery, Oostvleteren, Belgium. This was a 2010 Vintage. A dark brown/black coloured pour with a medium beige head on top. Sweet, boozy, dark fruit, caramel aroma. Tastes sweet, boozy, dark fruit, caramel, rum and raisin. Elegant Belgian Strong.

Pours deep black with thick tan head. Nose is chocolate and dark fruits. Aromas are coffee, chocolate, caramel, candi and some spices (pepper). Low carbonation, full body. Long coffee finish. Excellent Belgian ale!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle shared, thanks Jon. 2009 vintage. Rich raisin character, chocolate cake, liquor, sweet finish with a boozy edge. Great stuff if not a little past its prime maybe.

Piana pƒôkajƒÖca, b≈Çyskawicznie znikajƒÖca do zera, jak na coli. Barwa brƒÖzowo rubinowa, lekko mƒôtna. Aromat ciekawy, nie jest mo≈ºe ekstremalnie intensywny, ale wielowymiarowy - jest wanilia, jest stare drewno, jest rum, karmel, toffi, rodzynki, ciemne winogrono, suszone jab≈Çko, tyto≈Ñ, palono≈õƒá... Bottle from Jon shared at a tasting. Thanks Jon! 2009 vintage aged about 6 years. Brown sugar, sorghum, light oak and rum raisin cake all over the nose. Below average to soft carbonation with a full, rich body. Loaded with rum-cake and dark fruit. Lingering finish with light booze, sorghum and fruit that coats the palate. Very nice.

Pours almost pitch black. Dark. Brown, with a beige head. Aroma has some bread, a bit of woody oak barrel, beautiful depth. First sip is sweet as a dessert. Roasted malt, dried dark fruits and a nice milk chocolate finish. Complex and enticing, Glad I could taste this. 
.

Bottle 2009 at home. Very dark brown with beige head that leaves barely any trace. Fresh figs, dates, dried dark plums, brown sugar, port wine, red wine reduction, marzipan, licorice, spices, cocoa beans. Just lots of sweet dried fruits and oxidized vinous notes. Quite sweet with soft bitter finish. Over medium bodied with low carbonation and slick feel. Massive beer, very complex and enjoyable. I¬íve had better Pannepots before but this holds its own too.

Bouteille 330ml. Couleur brune tr√®s fonc√©e presque noire, mousse beige fonc√©e √©vanescente. Ar√¥me de fruits confits, amande, malt, m√©lasse, pain, tabac, sherry? Go√ªt de fruits confits, dattes, alcool, malt caram√©lis√©, sucr√©, amande. Carbonatation moyenne-√©lev√©e, corps dense.

January 25, 2016. Vintage 2010. 
Dark reddish brown with a tiny tan head. Aroma is sweet toffee, prunes, pear, figs, raisins, dates, hints of wood, licorice, calvados and hints of spices. Taste is sweet, light boozy and very soft bitter. Finish is sweet malty and fruity with toffee, prunes, figs, dates, baked pear, sweet licorice, light dry wood notes and hints of warming calvados alcohol. Medium to full bodied, soft carbonation. 
Very sweet with a light dry woody finish making it very drinkable.

330ml bottle. 2010 vintage. 100th Belgium rating. Pours black-brown in colour with a foamy beige head that diminishes. Dark malts, brown sugar, caramel, raisins, bready notes in the aroma. Flavour has roasted malt, liquorice, dark fruits, bitter chocolate, caramel, brown sugar, bread, with some woody oak, spicy bitterness and a lingering warm boozy note. Medium bodied, soft to medium carbonation, dry roasty bitter finish. Nice complexity, very drinkable.

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2016 Si presenta di un colore bruno con riflessi ciliegio. La schiuma è fugace ed impalpabile di un magnifico colore nocciola. Al naso si ritrovano i sentori di cioccolato e frutti neri avvolti da un suadente legnoso. In bocca è vellutata e dolce con una mistura di cioccolata e frutti rossi che appaga da subito la bevuta. Sul finale domina il legno scaldato da un vigoroso calore alcolico.

My 500th rating and Wow. 2010 vintage. Red wine and chocolate dominate the aroma. Dark black with tan head that almost entirely disappears. Lovely imperial stout milky sweetness and silky body. Some nutty roasted malts followed by lots of chocolate. Totally fantastic! Lightest amount of bite to it, which compliments the stout similarities. Defo get the oak, like a nice sweet whisky. A big beer and perfect end to a good day.

Bottle at home. 2010 vintage. Aroma is dark malt, raisins, oak, caramel, some chocolate, some booze, ripe sweet dark fruits, spices, plum, hint of wine, candy sugar. Flavour is rather sweet, but it fits the aroma. Body is nicely full and thick. Rich and complex. Great!

Bouteille(recolte 2006): Almost black, small - as usual - foamy layer; moderate to solid woody and winous nose, caramel and traces of chocolate included; medium to solid sweet flavour with a barely detectable bitterness, full bodied, quite soft; slightly lingering sweet vinous and caramelly finish with supporting traces of wood. Good, no doubt. But I expected an extra

Bottiglia del 2010, invecchiata 5 anni. Nera con schiuma beige molto sottile. Aroma liquoroso, alcolico, caramello, dark fruits. La bevuta scorre piacevole, consistenza oleosa, liquorosa, avvolgente, dolce ma non stucchevole. Birra invecchiata alla grande. Carbonazione leggera. Splendida birra da meditazione.

33cl bottle 2010 vintage¬ífrom Valhallas Goat ,Glasgow
 pours a dark brown with a beige head that does not last.
 Aroma is heavy sweet grain with bitter coffee liquorice
 Taste is bitter dry with sweet tones,long dry bitter finish
 very nice beer

UPDATED: OCT 23, 2016 Head disappears quite quickly. Dark brown colour. Plum liqeur, dark fruits, coffee, caramel in the aroma. Dryed smoked plums, coffee, cognac. Some acididness fruit in the middle. Raisin, rum, spices in the aftertaste. Very well balanced, medium bodied, medium carbonated, very complex, tasty, amazing beer. Full of suprises. Total enjoyment.

As Struise Pannepot Grand Reserva 2011. 330ml bottle. Brownish, bit hazy colour. Beige line of froth around the glass. Dark fruits, plums, toffee, vanilla, tanins in the aroma. Plums, dark fruits, toffee, some biterness at first. Spicy notes, berriewine, notes of calvados, toffee and vanilla in the end. Powerful aftertaste. Spicy notes, berries, some alcochol, dried fruits in the aftertaste. Sharp bubbly mouthfeel. Very well balanced, complex, exceptional beer. Wow.

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2016 Cellar cleanup tasting at deanso¬ís. Vintage 2009 from kermis, thanks! Black with thin tan head. Very soft and smooth. Caramel malts, toffee, dades and vanilla. Very good. Big body soft carbo. Olive oil texture. Long smooth lingering sweet finish. 
Bij Mrk. Fles. Heerlijk complex, zacht en zoet. Donker om in te verdwalen. Backlog from 2015/08/19.

Poirs dark with minimum head which diminishes quite quickly. Strong aroma of roasted malt, oak and cognac. Taste is very full and sweet, almost no carbonation, excellently balanced and still quite drinkable for a 10 vol% of alcohol. A fine beer specimen.

Bottle in a side by side comparison with Reserva 2010, drunk in a teku glass.
Thin brown head of no retention. Aroma was quite muffled initially but developed fully as the beer got to room temperature, featuring sweet malt notes, plums, a bit of alcohol and dried fruit. 
Body was medium with little carbonation. Taste followed the aroma with a spicy finish not as lasting as the Reserva, but in all in all the flavor was almost perfectly balanced. A beautiful beer, worth the rep.

Robe rubis dense. Nez puissant et complexe sur des notes de vanille, de caf√© froid, d ¬í√©pices, de malt. Bouche √† l¬íattaque plus cr√©meuse que le reserva, une belle tension, de l¬íamertume et une finale sur le chocolat am√®re. Une bi√®re plus stricte que la reserva mais aussi longue et complexe.

33cl bottle (2010 Vintage) in The Caf√© Red Rose, Brugge on 1st Dec 2015.

Dark brown pour, the head weak and wispy. The aroma is full on and intense with some cherries in a caramel puddle within an old whisky barrel doused in dark chocolate. The taste carries on way, cherry, caramel, whisky and dark chocolate, now add some Port into the flavouring: just divine from start to finish.

330 ml bottle. Bought in La mise en biere in Lausanne. Got the 2010 edition. Smell: chocolate, alcohol, sour, wine, wood, almonds. Dark color with brown head. Sour reserved taste, obviosly oaked. Made me thought in a Petrus oaked beer, but this one is better. Not my cup of tea, but is well made.

Huge thanks to Travlr for the chance to have some Struise beers. At 10 years old, Pannepot was the oldest of the Struise beers Gene sent to us. It was also the best. Pannepot poured dark brown and was, remarkably, quite heady. Big candy aroma. Taste was amazingly complex. Syrup, buttery cocoa, dark fruits, vinous grape, juicy red grape, toasted malt. Feel was warm and soft. Beautiful drinking experience all around. I never would¬íve guessed something with this much age could be so good.

(Thanks, Gene! "Travlr")

A- Dark fruits, port wine, subtle booze, oak, chocolate truffles.

A- Dark brown black color, dark liquid, off white head.

T- Dark fruits, cherries, chocolate syrup, chocolate truffles, caramel, molasses, raisins. 

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, complex finish.

O- Had a Vintage 2005, so 10 years old. And it was outstanding. The complexity of what this bottle showed was nothing short of delicious. Very happy to have tried it but now very sad it¬ís gone.

Dark brown body and small head. Aromatic beer, complex, very rich but and indeed not restraint yet balanced perfectly. It does lose some of the character of the normal version, with foresty freshness, but it is replaced with better aging. This development time give a great aroma mostly, but also helps smoothen out the edges. I would have liked it a bit sweeter, but that¬ís personal. (33cl bottle from QV.ID)

2008 bottle. Nearly black whith small light beige head. Aroma has malt, caramel and dried fruit. Flavour has a light vinous note. Woody with dried fruit and some chocolate and booze. Finishes rather fruity with light alcohol burn.

2010 vintage bottle @ Bishops Folkis, 15/3-15.
App: Dark brown, almost black with a brief pale brown head.
Aroma: Complex mature aroma with oak, raisins, figs, bourbon, vanilla, alcohol, slightly burnt rye bread.
Taste: Raisins and bourbon/alcohol, slightly burnt and with a gentle acidic touch, tobacco and figs, dark bread, peppery but smooth.
Palate: Medium to big body, soft scrubbing carbonations, oily.

Pours very dark amber with brown head. Aroma of toffee, chocolate, berry, dried fruit, red wine. Dry. Smooth. Very well balanced.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours murky slight amber. Aroma is Woody, malty, slight sour. Taste is sour, balanced. Lighter than I expected. Nice Balance.

Vintage 2010.
Pours dark brown, brown head.
Some roasted notes in there, lots of flavours going on in this beer.
Tastes really great

2010 grand reserva. Dark brown, modest head, oily. A: very intense, deep aroma. Cherry bonbons, caramel malts, bock, hint of whisky, dark chocolate. T: deep, robust taste. Cherry bock start, oily mouthfeel. Development reminds of red porto, ends with chocolate, red fruits. Aftertaste is surprisingly neutral. Such a nice balance. Top.

Pannepot...fra le migliori birre belga del mondo! In questa versione √® straordinariamente complessa..scura,con riflessi rubino e schiuma beige che forma uno strato millimetrico,ma sempre presente..aroma carico di emozioni..frutta matura,prugna,datteri,saltata a dovere..sentore legnoso che non pizzica troppo e la rende molto gradevole..gusto caldo,avvolgente,leggermente speziata..forse cannella e noce moscata.ma nel complesso riflette l¬íaroma..malto,frutta matura,sentori lievito di che le danno una nota complessa da spavento! Amazing!

0.33l bottle. Very dark brown body, light-brown head. Both the aroma and the taste are quite red wine-like with notes of cocoa, berries, caramel and some booze. For me it¬ís way smoother than the other Pannepots but for some reason it¬ís not that intense.
Bottle. Deep amber color with a descending foamy brown head. Sweet aroma of candy, vanilla and fruits. Sweet and slightly bitter taste. Sweet finish. Medium body.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Pours black with a brown head. Aroma is malt, roast, caramel, dark fruit and some woody notes. Taste is medium to high sweet leading to a nice oaky finish. Excellent

Bottle,2010 reserve, pours deep cherry red with a tan head, caramel malt and candy sweetness, deep and fruity, notes of cherries, blackberries and cream, red grape and oaky finish. Light medium bodied, creamy, oily texture, light spice and light bitterness to finish.

Pours in a dark red brown color with a tanned head that disappears fast. Aroma; Prunes, dark fruit, earthy and woody notes, alcohol and some chocolate and caramel. Flavours; Sweet dark fruits, wood, earth, malt, raisins, chocolate and alcohol. A complex and prety well balanced good beer.

2010 vintage bottled 11/2014. Pours black with a creamy tan foam. Complex aroma of licorice, yeast and dark fruits. Full body, creamy feel, soft/avg carbonation. Taste of burnt caramel, oak and spices. Long lasting smoky and boozy finish.
Pannepot grand reserva 2010, bottle, 33cl. Bottiglia forse non conservata benissimo, purtroppo. Poca schiuma, aroma ottimo, inferiore alla pannepot normale ma sempre una gran bevuta.

Olmost black with a small white head - Malt aroma with dark fruits in there as well - Good sweet malt body with dark fruits with some hints of wood and wine - The dark malts and fruits goes into a long finish with some nice alcohol heat to go with it - This was real good

Bottle 2008 courtesy of George at the Hoppy pub in Greece. Thank you. Pours chestnut skin brown color, brownish minimal foam disappearing quickly. Nose: macerated cherries (under spirit), dry fruit, wood. Balanced and elegant. Great. Mouth: mirroring the nose but a bit on a basic side, more syrupy, frizzy-peppery finish.

Bottle, 2009. Pours dark red brown, small fizzy head. In aroma chocolate, caramel ,prunes, figs, liquor, wood, raisins. In taste sweet, fruity and very chocolately, woody notes present too.Full bodied, oily, sweet in the finish. Great.

Bottle at home (vintage 2010, lot: 102122150910 bottled: 11/2014). Pours dark red brown, almost black with a small fizzy fast disappearing head. Sweet aroma of chocolate, caramel, malts, wood, alcohol, raisins, dark fruits. Taste is sweet, dark fruits, chocolate, alcohol, malts, wood, alcohol towards the end. Sticky sweet aftertaste of chocolate, malts and dark fruits. Very nice.

33cl bottle (vintage 2010) from Vinmonopolet Stovner, Oslo. Pours clear deep mahogany with a small, beige head. Lovely fruity and malty aroma with dried dark fruits, apples, caramel, candy sugar and hints of chocolate and spices. Sweet, complex and simply delicious! Very balanced and surprisingly smooth mouthfeel with a medium long aftertaste . Some notes of alcohol and wood, but very well integrated. Delicious stuff!

Vintage 2010
WYGLƒÑD: Barwa ciemnobrunatna, nieprzejrzyste. Piana drobna, niska, kr√≥tka. 
AROMAT: Intensywny. Wi≈õnie w alkoholu, ≈õliwka suszona, rodzynki, ciemna gorzka czekolada , przejrza≈Çe jab≈Çka. W tle nuty beczkowe (wanilia). 
SMAK: Likier z suszonych owoc√≥w le≈ºakowany w beczce - tak najkr√≥cej mo≈ºna opisaƒá to piwo. Posmak gorzkiej czekolady. Alkohol ≈õwietnie ukryty w smaku, choƒá z czasem uderza...do g≈Çowy.
