330ml bottle from Systembolaget, 2010 vintage, purchased in February 2015. Nearly black with a creamy, short lasting, beige head, leaving some lacing. Sweet and earthy, complex aroma, caramel, toffee, oak, booze. Fairly strong carbonated, small fizzy bubbles on the tongue and then a creamy mouthfeel, full bodied. Smooth fruit and berry taste with sweet caramel and oak barrels. Figs, cherries, raisins, caramel, vanilla, ash, chocolate, calvados, vinous. Finish dry with long fruit flavors that lingers.

330ml bottle [2010 vintage]. Darkest brown colour with an intimation of a ruby red glimmer and average, frothy, reawakening, fairly lasting, minimally lacing, beige head. Fruity and chocolately aroma, lots of dried fruit, raisin, prune, fig, a touch of oak and balsamico, apple-Calvados-wood. Taste is moderately sweet fruity, notes of dried fruit, raisin, prune, fig, fresh fruity notes as well, red and yellow apple, a touch of baked apple, Calvados, an oaky touch, milk chocolately fill-in, off and on slightly vinous; in the finish cautious hints of warming alcohol. Full body, soft palate; rich and complex, mild and balanced. Almost easy drinkable due to its harmonious composition.

Bottle from West Lakeview Liquors (Chicago, IL). 2010 Vintage. Pours a deep brownish ruby hue, mahogany purple ruby glow hits the body. A firmer haziness, dark middle with just a hint of rubyfire on the edges striking nicely. Frothy tannish head atop is decent sized, a nice layer sticks around but dies quicker, mellow ringer atop is smaller, concise with solid lacing atop. Aromas are lovely and deep, darker candi sugars, biscuit and touches of caramel meet some mellow spiciness, yeasty life and jabs of allspice, black cherry and dried fruit. Some oaky presence, depth with tannic vanillin. Candy sugars, gentle estery fruit as more cherryskin, some oak and spirit life through that depth and deeper sweetness. A bit of cakey sweetness, chocolatey and vanilla and mellow cherry, faint anise and spiciness still hanging on. Initial is medium bodied, a bit more full with some tannic woody depth, gentle caramel and brown sugar, touches of plum and dried fruit, black cherry and spiciness. A mellow yeasty life, allspice and anise, almost a cool spiciness really with that yeasty zest. Caramel, a bit of fudgey chocolate and earthiness, tannic oak and a bit of yeastiness. Toasty, cocoa jabs and a coolness as we round the corner. It¬ís amazing how light on the palate this ends up, complex and deeper flavors with a nice tannic element throughout without overbearing or ending up brooding. A bit of cola, cherries, dark and a bit pulpy with some some nice depth. This ends up tantalizingly drinkable despite it¬ís hefty ABV tag. A bit of stickiness lingers, darker and a bit toasty, tannic with some faint residual sugars and barrel lingering nicely, subtle spice, carmelized malts and some dark fruit and cocoa. Really nice damn stuff. Well done. Totally see why this is a classic. While the nose ends up a bit mellow, this thing is delicious, deep and complex with good balance and goes down really easy.
Tasted at my Whales and Whimps bottle share. Caramel, toffee. Pretty full body. Plum and fig. Tasted side by side with the Pannepot Reserva. Some oak.

2006 vintage @ kulminator July 15
Looks..Blackest of browns, sml latte head.
Smells.. Caramel, liquorice, oak and some of the calvados barrel 
Tastes.. The calvados barrel is still very present here, caramel malty and a fair bit of alcohol heat, the liquorice covers the gums..slight pepper/spices and a hint of vanilla... This beer is like wide screen and surround sound for the mouth.

Vintage 2009.
Aroma: soy sauce, plum, dried fruits, honey, caramel, candy, licorice alcohol in the background
Taste: heavy sweet, caramel, honey, fruity, soy sauce, licorice, alcohol in the background
Incredibly smooth, full body

R√∂dbrun n√§stan svart med. Torkad frukt och fikon lite j√§st i doft. Intensiv smak och fyllig munk√§nsla. Len och trevlig, lite samma smaker efter en hel flaska

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2009 Vintage and happy to get a chance to rate this on a cleaner palate. Much thanks to willrunforbeer. Dark brown color no head. Aroma is very nice, massive dark fruits (raisins, dates, figs) with a definitive amount of spice and notes of yeast. 
Just a great sipper all the way around. No alcohol in the flavor. Full body with the malts and yeast giving the dark fruit and Spice hints that are very balanced. No one aspect of the flavor over-powers another. The most impressive thing is at 6 years old it shows no oxidation or flaws. That actually really amazes me. That being said, it is a top Belgian strong ale with good reason.

11.2oz, 2009 vintage. Pours dark brown with a surprising beige head. Aroma is brown bread, raisin, cinnamon, spice. Wow! Flavor is off the chart! Sweet, raisin, date, cinnamon, spice. Molasses finish. Amazing for a 6 year old beer.

Vintage 2010 bottle from Pivoljub, Ljubljana, Slovenia. Shared with Igor and lovely Anja. Very fruity nose, dry fruits, malty syrup, barrel. Alcohol well hidden, thick and syrupy, sweet. Dry fruits, sugars, sweet finish.
Pours a black body with a brown beige head. Starts out light, quickly bringing on a taste of oak along with roasted notes of chocolate and caramel, with small hints of coffee.

330mL bottle from Beer Cartel. Vintage 2010
Sort of surprised I overlooked this beer - always figured there was just 1 Pannepot, and that was it.
Deep, nearly opaque bronze beer, holds a creamy tan head.
Decadent, almost fortified wine-like nose to it- burnt toffee, earthy dark candy sugar, licorice, lots of raisins, date, dried figs, sultanas, prunes, yet still plums and blackcurrant esters in there too, savoury clovey spices, black pepper and nutmeg, and old oak. 
Carbonation is quite high, smooth, slighlty velvety, rich body yet doesn¬ít give away too much of that substantial abv, just a flirting of warmth.
Richly complex palate - dark brown sugar, bruised apple, sultana, freshly ground nutmeg, burnt fig, nutty old port-like rancio, dried leafy herbs (almost like bay or sage or something). Bitterness relatively high for style, really long drawn out finish.
This is the sort of ale you¬íve gotta take your time, hide away in a dark corner and just thoroughly enjoy every drop of. Sitting in front of a roaring place seems apt enough for this tasting. Needless to say, this is just fantastic!
Aroma is dark fruit/grapes and a real hint of heat/alcohol. The flavor is dark fruit, grapes, malts, mild heat, slight funk and a mix of sour and caramel sweetness in the finish.

2010 vintage (from beergium.com). Pours brown with beige head. The head doesn¬ít stay. Aroma is sweet, apples, malt, oak, raisins, and some alcohol. Flavor is sweet, malt, oak, cellar, fruits. Overall: very good.
2005 vintage (shared by FatPhil, thanks!). Pours similar to fresher one, aroma is sweet, buttery, oxidised, more raisins. Flavor is sour, fruits, wood, oak, malt, some sweetness. Overall: I liked the fresher one a lot more, it was more intense. Rating for 2005 vintage: 6:3:7:3:14=3.3

2010 vintage bottle fomr the Trembling Madness in York. Pours mahogany with no lasting head. The aroma is port, oak and booze. The taste starts with a little sweetness and light spice before flavours of raisin, port, wood, leather and tobacco. Loads of flavours going on. Quite a boozy too, but enjoyably so. Quite high carbonation. Great beer.

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2015 2010 : Du fruit√© : cerises et fruits rouges m√ªrs et mass√©r√©s.De la liqueur.De la douceur.Un corps qui porte sans trop en faire.Un taux d¬íalcool qui, present, n¬íemporte pas tout.

Excellent.
Meilleur belge brune ?

FFFFFFFFFFFFFFFh, excellent.

Bottle from the Struise shop in Bruges. Brown, quite high carbonation. First thing I noticed was how insanely drinkable this is, fruity, cake, a little yeasty, spicy, hints of the oak. Sweetish but bitter enough. Really nice, I¬íd want to re-rate to confirm how good!

2010 bottle at home while in Amsterdam. Pours a dark reddy brown with a tan head. Big dark fruit, rummy, raisin aroma. Medium body, full carbonation. A surprising lack of body - thin. Still very sticky, with liquorice, treacle, light vanilla, a light smoky meatiness, rum and dark fruit. The after taste is a bit cloying and a touch metallic. Just OK.

Vintage 2009

Aroma is very wine like. Pours near black with a lace of nearly white head. Taste is delicious. Rich complex malt, with just enough roast to keep it from cloying. Thick. Light carb. Some wine flavor. Dark chocolate, coffee, Toffee, caramel?
Grand Reserva bottle from 2009. Prunes, raisins, molasses. Sweet and smooth. Fantastic beer!

Bottle from Beergium. Dark brown color, beige head. Bitter taste with roasted malts, toffee, caramel, nuts, a bit of chocolate, ripe fruits, earthy notes and a bit of yeast. Bitter finish with toffee, chocolate, nuts, earthy notes and ripe fruits. Exquisite belgian strong ale.

Bottle from Saveur Bi√®re (2010). Creamy beige head with dark brown body. Smells dried meat, vanilla, chocolate, apricot, coffee. Tastes sugar, apricot, nuts, vanilla. Very smoky and sweet with a bitter finish.

Dark brown colour, moderate sized dense beige head; aroma of dried fruits (plum and raisin), roasted sugar, minimal herbal and alcoholic notes; taste is the same with biscuit, hints of chocolate, slight sourness, woody and syrupy notes and spicy alcohol; amazing beer

Bottle @ Home. 2010. Clear ruby dark brown, medium off white head, some lacing and coating. Aroma, roasted notes, caramel, toffee, chocolate, plums, dark fruits, red wine notes, figs, . Taste, malty, caramel, roasted notes, vanilla, dark fruits, chocolate, . Really smooth. Oily mouth feel. Low carbonation.

2010 bottle. Pours deep brown reddish hue with a thin tight beige film. Aroma is tart fruit malt candied sugars plums caramel malt. Taste is smooth dark fruit slightly tart plums subtle oak sugars caramel. Palate full fluffy carbonation an dry. Great.
Bottle shared by Jeff - thanks! Dark brown pour with a smaller dense tan head. Rich dark fruit and oak. Slick and oily on the palate. Yum.

Bottle,2010 reserve, pours deep cherry red with a tan head, caramel malt and candy sweetness, deep and fruity, notes of cherries, blackberries and cream, red grape and oaky finish. Light medium bodied, creamy, oily texture, light spice and light bitterness to finish. Soft carbonation.
Pours the darkest of browns. Almost black. Aromas of sweet grapes, prunes, dates, figs. Vinous. Flavours are molasses, dried grapes, dried apples, dates. 2009. The age has mellowed this wonderfully.

Deep brownish black color with half finger of khaki head. Smells of sweet malt, chocolate, dark fruit, grape, apple. Taste is like a chocolate fruit cake with some nuttiness. Smooth taste from age, alcohol hidden well. Some oak and a touch of the brandy barrel on the finish in the form of a slight tart apple.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very dark brown colour, beige head. Aroma of dark fruits, chocolate, apple, toffee, cherries and vanilla. Taste is light sweet, dark fruit flavour. Medium body, creamy smooth texture, lively carbonation. Very nice.

2010. Deep dark brown with ruby lacing. Tiny not persistent beige head. Complex aroma. Plum, raisin, chocoloate and cherry notes. Light wood notes. Taste as complex. Lots of plum with liquorice. Caramel raisin and chery. It all move toward a port like flavour. Long port finish. Oily body and high carbo. Great beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, 33 cl, 2009 vintage at Novare Res, Portland, Me. Pours brown slight ruby chestnut color large tan head. Aroma is dark fruits, cherry, raisin, cinnamon, oak. Flavor is dark fruits, bottle age is very tame with this many years on it. Spice is still prevalent especially in the back of the throat. Excellent. Especially for a 6 year old beer.

Bottle 0.33l at home, Nivala. Vintage 2009. Colour is dark brown with very small brownish head. Aromas and flavours: Wood, dryness, some caramel, some coffee, hints of dark fruits and malts. Very woody and dry. Perhaps too old. Getting simple and "red winish".

Bottle, 33cL. @Palais_de_la_Bi√®re, Poitiers. A sparkling black beer with brown hues at the top of my glass ; small head poorly persistent. Aroma of caramel, licorice, fruits (raisin, fig), wood, toast, biscuit. Medium sweet ; round ; warming. Full body, oily medium texture, soft carbonation, fruity finish, light warming background. Overall, a delicious beer ; compared to " SP Reserva", this one is more "elegant" and oily ; nevertheless, I prefer "SP Reserva" because of its texture.

Bottle, 2010 vintage. Almods dark color, tan head reduce to thin layer. Aroma is vinous, dried fruits like plums, rasings, candied cherries, vanilla, oak, caramel. Taste is sweet with dry alcohol note at finish. Flavor of candied cherries, rasings, chocolate, roasty notes. Aftertaste is long and dry roastyness with dark chocolate, coffee and alcohol note. Full body, soft carbonation and velvet but oily texture. Very nice stuff.

Side by side tasting of 2005 & 2010 @martjoobolut¬ís, thanks. [Numbers according to 2010]. 
2005- Clear dark brown color. Small size, bubbly beige head, stays. Fruity, sweet, woody, raisins in aroma. Raisins, sourish, oxidized, plums/prunes in taste. Tastes old. Raisiny sourness in aftertaste. Plums stones too. In a weird way- refreshing? (7/4/7/4/14=3,6)
2010- Murky dark brown color. Tiny to almost no head. Dark fruits, plums, anise, medical, raisins, oak, woody, sweet notes in aroma. Sweet, raisins, oak, woody, candy caramel in taste. Woody and sweet caramel in aftertaste. Alcohol is very well hidden in both brew. But this one is more full of flavor and simple complexity. Wonderful!

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2016 330ml bottle - thanks martjoobolut - vertical tasting 2010 vintage (6+:4:7:4:14=3.5+)
First aroma is calvados. Dry woody oaky aroma, some acetone, spicy, nice dark roast. Full palate,but also pleasantly light. Nice roasty taste, fairly mellowed with age. Finish keeps the roast, some clovelike spice, dry old bitter hops, and banana hints. Covers alcohol very well. Improves with each sip. To be honest, started a little disappointing, but I ended up really liking it.
330ml bottle (Cracked Kettle, Amsterdam) (7:4:8:4:15=3.8)
Pleasantly oxidised aroma, malty, less roasty, nice fruity esters hinting at dark fruits. Lovely sharp palate, cherry sharpness. Love the balance of the aged Raisins in the finish, prunes too. Love the sharpness, the vapours up the back of the nose. Massively prefer this to the "young" one. 
Revisit: 2011 bottle at Koht 
Sourness is nicely taking over, but this is still perfectly balanced. Lovely soft lightness through the barique influences. The Flemish red aspects with just a hint of caramel are really pressing our buttons. 
7 5 8 4 16

Vintage 2010. Dark brown beer, small tan head. Nose is dark fruits, raisins, caramel, oak. Flavor is spice, oak, dried and overripe fruit, some oxidized notes, some alcoholic notes, candi sugar. Finish is fruity and boozy. Smooth and complex, very nice.

Bottle 2005 vintage poured a clear reddish brown with a small lasting tan head. Aromas of toffee, tobacco, dried fruit, light vinous notes and light oak. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of toffee, tobacco, light dried fruit and light oak with a smooth lingering toffee finish.

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2017 Bottle Vintage 2010. watching snooker The Masters 2017. What a Rocket beer. Aroma deep and complex. Wood, dark malts, candi sugar, fruits like figgs and dry raisins. It has a very dark brown appearance, the palate is quite exceptional. Taste is so smooth and so complex without being overdone.

330 ml (vintage 2010)
Appearance: Pours a dark brown color without a real head.
Aroma: Prunes, molasis , wood, candy sugar, nuts, alcohol
Taste: Starts moderate, but lingers to really sweet, but the earthy hops save it from becomming cloying.. Sweet malts, toffee, treacle, molasses, figs, prunes , spices,cloves, cherries, oak,Alcohol is not really there i the taste. Earthy hops finish it off and avoid cloying sweetness.. Quite complex. And after 1 bottle you clearly haven¬ít noticed everything. So a very nice complexity.

Full body, moderate carbonation, light sticky texture.
12oz bottle if 2009 vintage. Pours a dark brown color without much head. Good carbonation. Smooth, slight toffee and mild sweetness.
Versa colore scuro come caff√® .Frutta, caramello ho gi√† detto caramello.Divina.Il Belgio

10%ABV. Strong Porter.

I opened a bottle of properly chilled 2010. Poured out of the bottle with no head.

40¬∞SRM. Black brown color like the local coffee in Singapore, carmelized till it pours out black as sin.

Sweet nose full of prunes and honey plums, with a little more brightness so that you don¬ít get a lot of preserved fruit. This is special since strong porters tend to have that tang of preservation in the nose. Light residual wood smoke in small wisps with honey and caramel. Very pleasing. Very inviting.

Lightly carbonated mouthfeel with a moderately alcoholic palate. Brief bitter hops and then a very smooth slide into vanilla beans, honey dates, leaf tobacco, toffee, dark chocolate and some burnt sugar syrup. All ponderous flavors but floating on an ether so light and perfectly balanced with just enough hops to bring each flavor to the fore without being cloying.

Goes on Favorites List big time!
Bottle. Pour is black with a thin head, aroma is toffee, sweet. Taste is toffee, sweet, caramel. Fantastic

Jajamen, det h√§r var riktigt gott skit. Smaken var fint balanserad p√• en behaglig och stabil kropp. Smaken bar toner av plommon, ekfat, russin och belgisk j√§stkultur. Slutsats; sluta skriva b√∂rja dricka!

Aroma: caramel, molasses, overripe prunes, wood. Appearance: hazy, dark brown, small, beige head. Taste: medium sweet. Palate: sweets continue, dark, overripe fruits, caramel, oak, brown sugar syrup, some alcohol, long, subtle finish. Overall: fantastic Belgian Strong Ale, immensely complex in aroma and particularly palate. Bottle from BrewDog, Holborn.

Shared a bottle of this with Rachel at Bierboom in Brugges. First ever beer on Belgian ground. I was amazed to see a beer like this for sale for only 3euros. 2010 bottle. Pours murky dark Brown with a small beige head. Potent aroma of sweet boozy malt. Prune juice, candy sugar and rich woodiness. It tastes sublime. Sweet and warming. Notes of raisins, prunes and burnt sugar. Amazing depth of flavour. Tremendous barrel ageing. Incredible beer.
Sweet, fruity, earthy exquisite Wood aging. Complex and layer upon layer of flavours and aromas. Hazy copper colour, medium beige head. A real treat!

Bottle, 2009 vintage. This is one mighty brew. It checks all the boxes for me. Aroma is of roasted nuts and apricots ad flavor is raisins, wallnuts with nice warmth from the alcolhol. The complexity of the flavors stays with you from the first vapors to long after the last sip. Great beer to enjoy.

Bottle 2010. This is something of a whale for me. Nose is malty, blackberry, dark cherry, cola , figs, treacle, molasses, more subtle and sweeter oak than often found, chocolate, smoke, vanilla, brandy, fruit cake. Amazing rich and complex.

Taste is drier than expected, turning sweet as it lingers on the pallet. Sweet malts, toffee, treacle, molasses, figs, honey, spice, cloves and anise, cherry, plums, a little earthy hop lift that avoids it being cloying. 

Mouthfeel is a little sticky but not unpleasant.

It¬ís a truly exceptional beer, it¬ís always a worry when one waits years for a beer but this was as good as expected.

June 1st 2015. Birth of my second son and rating #100. Great timing!
Very much comparable with the reserva, maybe a little less wineous and sharper. I would have to taste them side by side to make sure of the differences.

Shared 2010, 330ml. bottle poured to snifters at Tim¬ís 40th, displaying a deep mahogany color, with a presentable layer of brownish tan head foam, and spots & strands of lacing. The nose offered a plethora of notes that seemed to vary after every whiff. Those that I could pin down were a touch of roastiness & light cocoa, caramel, toffee, and treacle sweetness, some floral perfume, esters as dark grape & cherry, a hint of banana, and subtle spices as clove. Medium+ bodied, with soft but appropriate carbonation, the taste incorporated a majority of the aroma notes, continued the melanoidin-like sweetness, offered a bit of tartness, moderate earthy & tannic astringency, and alcohol that was port-like and warming. A highly complex treat that was ideal for the occasion!

0.33 bottle. Very dark brown color and virtually no head. Aroma of oak, chocolate, spices, delicate sugar, hints of toffee, and just as the description suggests - bourbon and calvados. Taste is sweet, malty, delicate bourbon, a slight sting of alcohol, some fruits, once again spices; yet it could be stronger. Medium body, oily texture, and a lively carbonation - the only drawback. Finish is fruitier, sweeter but also sourer, introduces delicate molasses; alcohol hangs on the verge of detectability but otherwise the same as the taste. Overall a marvelous beer; the barrels have imparted a substantial amount of taste and aroma, and I am definitely partial to BA beers.

Pannepot grand reserva ¬í09

Pours an almost black, dark brown color with ruby red undertones, and a spongy, light brown head.

Offers aromas of wood, coconut, toasty malts and earth. On top of that foundation settles peppery clove, sugared lemon peel and cardamon, coated up by melted toffee and a whiff of rock sugar. Reveals way less sweetness than the regular version, together with warm, old oak.

Has a lower carbonation with an utmost smooth mouthfeel, complimenting the rich oak flavours.

Tastes of wood bark, moldy earth, forest honey and toffee. The beer then gets topped of by melted caramel, slightly burning spices and sweet rock sugar. Offers a gentle alcoholic warmth, blending directly into the well pronounced spices. Ends with rich caramel and more, slightly burning spices on top of the balancing wooden earth.

Its low carbonation opens the palate up to many subtle flavors, topped off by the typical, spicy Pannepot sweetness, gently balanced by wood and earth, which is an aspect I do miss, regarding the beers regular version. Its wooden aspect compliments the spices, while revealing a pleasant warmth, with oak, which doesnt turn too present on its own. Its finish turns out to be a bit flat unless the barrel turns up, providing a neccesary earthiness, making the beers appearance complete.

2010. Honig und D√∂rrobst in der Nase, Karamell, belgische Hefe, Eiche, sehr fein, subtil, Banane. Am Gaumen Bratapfel, dunkle Fr√ºchte, gegen Ende Rotwein, herb-s√º√ülich, Eiche, Karamell, leicht alkoholisch. Extrem gut trinkbar, sehr weiches Mundgef√ºhl, ausbalanciert. Top.

Dark twilight brown, thin tan cusp. Greasy, brassy oak and licks of plum and tinselly oak. Lean brassy, husks of wholemeal soaked in soft balsamic and light caramel flurry. Bit thinner than the previous two stages, but finishes longer brassy and resonating appley tannin with a slushy oak linger. 2010 Vintage. 4.0
Hazier, neater crust of a head. The nose is incredible, baked apple and rustic vingear. Crusty burnt bakewell tart, roasted oak and licks of righteous, hearty mulched apple. Why is this so much more calvadossy than the 5 year younger version! Thinner, no doubt, but a few drops more sweetness on the finish. Linger is bullish and vinious.

Flaske 330ml. Gave fra Rune. Svart. H√∏yt mokkafaget skum som faller raskt sammen. Forsiktig sjokoladearoma. Silkemyk munnf√∏lelse. Smaken rosiner & svisker. Bra - men lite variasjon. Alkoholen brukbart kamuflert. Litt bunnfall.

UPDATED: MAY 30, 2015 Deep dark pour, almost impenetrable, small tan head. Very inviting aromas of port wine, raisins, oak, leather. The taste is really one to savour - sweet port wine, raisins, dates, plums, with oak tannins and a light smokiness helping to balance the sweetness. Nice warming alcohol. The body is lighter than expected but is probably a good thing, as it helps the sweetness avoid becoming cloying. This is just as memorable and enjoyable as the standard Pannepot. Incredible.

Bottle, 2010 vintage, bottled 2014. Pours black with a cream head. Aroma: wood, prunes, raisins, apples, clove, nutmeg, dates. Taste follows with caramel, syrup, cinnamon, touch of roast. Sweet, but not cloying, nice complementing bitterness, creamy texture, full body, soft carbonation. Lasting finish. Lovely, lovely.
Bottle from Systembolaget. Malty and light spicy, chocoalte, with oak aromas, vanilla. Similar taste. Smooth and creamy mouthfeel. Very nice beer. I love the original and this is just as good.

Bottle shared with daje, edvard and Simonsen at The "Esp0r #2000 Weekend in The Woods" 2014
Dark brown, tanned creamy head. Smell of raisins, dark fruits, toffee, hints of toast, red wine and oak. Moderate sweet, port and other vinous characters, hints of funk, raisins and prunes, dark rich fruity malts, totally quite exequite. Moderate bitter, earthy hops. Very nice, though i have to say the regular Pannepot is better

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Opis wersji "podstawowej": Butelka, 2014. Piekny wyglad - przy nalewaniu zachowuje sie jak bardzo geste, lepkie, oleiste. Piana sliczna, kremowa, nawet lekko wpadajaca w czerwone odcienie, bardzo drobna, niezbyt wysoka. Opada niezbyt szybko, pozostaje cienka warstewka, lekko zostaje na szkle, widac tez bardzo delikatne lzy na brzegach pokala. Aromaty bardzo bogate, karmel, ciemne owoce (sliwki, wisnie, banany), suszone owoce (rodzynki, sliwki suszone), przyprawowosc dosc nienarzucajaca sie, zbozowosc, slodowosc, kawa, nawet czekoladowo-kakaowe nuty. Alkohol praktycznie niewyczuwalny. Smak analogiczny - wszystko to czuc. Praktycznie brak goryczki. lekkie rozgrzewanie gardla od alkoholu. dlugie, owocowe, kwaskowate posmaki (jedyny zarzut ktory mi wpada do glowy - zbyt kwaskowate). W ustach pelne, niesamowicie kremowe, gladkie. Bardzo niskie wysycenie. Na chwile obecna: najlepsze piwo jakie mialem okazje pic w zyciu :)W wersji Grand Reserva (2010, butelkowana 11/2014) piwo jest ewidentni inne - aromaty i posmaki z beczki po Calvados sa bardzo intensywne - winne, jablkowe (jablka nieco przytlumily inne owoce, ale wcale nie do konca), ciut bardziej kwaskowate w smaku i mniej kwaskowate w posmaku. Wszelkie zalety wersji podstawowej (poza moze piana - tym razem skapa i szybko znikajaca) sa zachowane. W ustach wydaje sie wrecz lzejsze,,, Niezwykle bogate i zbalansowane. Trudno mi byloby wybrac pomiedzy nimi - oba sa wyraznie lepsze od skadinad wszak tez doskonalej wersji Reserva. Rami Rami is drinking a Pannepot Grand Reserva (2011) by De Struise Brouwers at Apartamenty Saska nad JezioremMniej ciala niz 2010, ale nadal fajowo desererowe jak zwykle Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

330ml bottle 2010 vintage from Saveur-Biere.fr. Pours opaque black with menacing beige head. Aroma is light cocoa and liquorice, continuing to the taste with caramel, cocoa and light liquorice nudging in. Exceedingly drinkable with a soft complexity but impressively well balanced.

Bottiglia vintage 2010. Colore nero con un cappello di schiuma beige abbastanza persistente, aroma di malto tostato, frutta sotto spirito e mi sembra vaniglia. Al palato √® piuttosto oleosa come corpo con note di caff√®, malto tostato e cioccolato e nel finale si fa sentire il Calvados, l¬íalcool non si fa mai sentire in maniera esagerata nonostante i 10¬∞. Una birra favolosa.

33cl bottle, vintage 2010. Near black in color, thin brown head. Chocolate first, then caramel sweetness, dark fruits, plum marmalade. Delicate aroma. Flavor has sweetness, syrup, dark fruits, plums, hops. Iicorice in finish. Nicely balanced. Sweet, but not sticky. So enjoyable, nice sipper. Sweetness hides the alcohol completely.

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2015 Grand Reserva 2009 Lotto 14081421032012.
Tonaca di frate con riflessi caramello e rossastri, schiuma beige poco persistente.
Aroma acetico, frutta matura (soprattutto uvetta e fichi), note di mela, cacao amaro, caramello, liquirizia, vino liquoroso, note legnose.
Al palato stesse caratteristiche, la gradazione alcolica √® sorprendentemente ben nascosta anche se riscalda la bevuta in modo impeccabile.
Corpo medio-pieno, poco carbonata.
Molto complessa e davvero notevole, un capolavoro.

Flaska fr√•n systembolaget (2010). M√∂rk brun/svart f√§rg med beiget skum. Fruktig doft av plommon, lite brandytoner.
Maltig smak med toner av k√∂rsb√§r, plommon, lakrits och tr√§. 
Ingen direkt eftersmak utan ett ganska kort avslut p√• en i √∂vrigt fin √∂l.

Pours dark brown with no head. Medium body. Nice mouth feeling.

2010 vintage, poured deep reddish brown with a frothy tan. Aroma of sweet berries, light liquorice, lightly spicy. Full body, flavour as the aroma, pretty smooth, light toffee, plums, vinous, boozy raisins, light wood.

2009 vintage. Pours dark brown with a thin beige head that¬ís short lived. Aromas of raisin, chocolate, caramel, prunes, oak, molasses, laquer, leather, spiced brandy. Wow. Taste is medium sweet, with medium bitterness popping up then fading while the fruity sweet hangs about for a long full finish. Medium body, a little oily, nice carbonation. This has a level of complexity and balance above even the 2010 Reserva I have tried, and more again over the standard Pannepot. Quite exceptional!

Pitch black, no head. Aroma of plum, dark fruit, berries, alcohol, oak, red wine. Taste is similar, oak more intense, caramel and chocolate. Soft to flat carbonation, creamy texture, medium body and medium sweetness. Complex and interesting one. (Pivoljub 0,33l bottle)

2010 vintage from Belgium in a Box - Rich deep ruby body, thick off white head. Aroma is a light combination of candied sugar, spice, cinnamon, oak and alcohol. Flavour is consistent with the aroma with raisin, caramel, sweet malt, an alcohol tingle with little sweetness and acidity on the finish. Smooth and light feel and a creamy texture of the body of this beer makes it fully bodied. Really quaffable.

Very nice, rich plum dark fruity, soft oaky nose. Full bodied, quite balanced,though, easy. Good dark fruits, strong malty sweetness, oaky leathery. Full of flavours, but nice balanced easy..-- bb

2009 bottle. Thanks ShroudofDoom! 
This was poured into a chalice. 
The appearance was a dark ruddy brown color with a slim white head that dissipated to a soft glaze of lacing. It slid nicely. 
The smell had a soft sweet dark fruit with a light sweet cherry, a little bit of coffee and a light chocolate shaping the aroma nicely.
The taste was mainly sweet through the previously mentioned flavors and gave an extremely sticky dark fruity aftertaste leading to a sweet wet fruity finish. 
On the palate, this one sat about a medium on the body with a decent sessionable quality about it. The carbonation was barely there but that¬ís okay considering this was a 2009 bottle. Sweet smooth sticky notes cling nicely to the feel of the beer over my tongue. 
Overall, oh wow, what a wonderful Belgian Strong Ale. For fans, this should be on everyone¬ís list.

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2015 Compra: XXXII

Opini√≥n: No esta mal aunque me defraudaron un poco las altas expectativas que tenia en ella

33cl bottle thanks to ruigo. Thanks Rui for this beast!! Vintage 2009. Dark red, brown color. Thin brown head. Medium sweetness and bitterness. Medium body. Aroma is chocolate, alcohol, brandy, malty, caramel.
Bottle. A lot like reserva with more fruit flavors and barrel character. Dark brown. Complex and delicious.
Bottle. Another dark brown / ruby pour with a little off white head. Similar to the Reserva but adds a little more fruity sweetness and spice. Base beer still shines through. Very nice.

(2010 bottle) Reddish brown colour with not much head on top. Aroma has tannin, red wine, chocolate, plums and dried fruits. Taste has chocolate, tannin and vanilla. Really soft flavours. Soft round and full body with minimal carbonation. New flavours coming up after every sip, great beer to enjoy nice and slow.

Dangerous and intimidating appearance. Enticing and soft taste. Elegant dark beer, not too sweet, not too dry. Some spices as well. This is what fine beer is like. If you don¬ít fancy porters and stouts, try this!

Poured from a 2009 vintage bottle. 
Aroma is moderately sweet with mostly dark caramel and toffee. Hints of chocolate and roast and even lighter notes of tobacco. Medium light raisin, fig and prune esters with a light clove and coriander phenolic note. A light brandy character with a hint of oak and sherry. 
Pours a dark brown with a bit of a burnt amber hue. A moderately sized, fairly thick, dark tan head with good retention as it recedes to a thin head that lingers thicker on the edges. Medium light lacing and moderate legs. 
Flavor is moderately sweet and a but sweeter in the finish. Lots of caramel, toffee, and burnt sugar notes. Lighter chocolate and treacle with faint roast and faint we tobacco. Here the phenolics are a bit stronger than in the aroma with some clove and a hint of anise. More brandy character as well. Light raisin, fig and prune. Hints of the alcohol. Medium bitterness balances out the sweetness a bit. 
Mouthfeel is medium full bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and medium low alcohol warmth. 
Overall, this is borderline perfect for the style. All the elements balance very nicely and work in harmony. The spices are complimentary as is the calvados and the alcohol is barely noticeable.

330 mml bottle tasted on the 18/04/2015. Dark borwn to amber colour. Vintage 2010 version. Intense aroma of cola, coffee and wood. Aroma of licorice, wood and cherries. Toffee and coffee aftertaste. Next one please!

Bue en bouteille de 33cl chez Will, couleur marron, mousse marron et effervescence moyenne, une attaque sur le caf√© et le calvados, attaque sur la pomme verte puis continuit√© sur l¬íalcool, deuxi√®me bouche sur le tonneau et la pierre de fusil, √ßa s¬íamplifie sur le caf√© et le caramel, fin de bouche √©norme sur le calva. Tuerie !!!!!

Randomly found a 2008? 2010? bottle down at City Beer Store, SF sometime last fall. Doubt they still have them, but worth a check. This puppy was still absolutely gorgeous in every way. Subtle chocolately oaked vanilla throughout, hidden Belgian sugars,berries, tobacco, light hints at leather (reminiscent of HOTD Adam), toffee, other fruits, and more. If you can find one, buy it. It¬ís that fucking good!
Clear dark ruby brown, light brown foam head. Nice warm wine aroma and taste, calvados apparently but I am not a wine drinker. Great beer. (Velp 201504)

2008 draught at Mead Hall, 4/9/15.Deep cocoa powder brown beer shows a high clarity and plentiful burgundy/auburn highlights on the edges. Beige head is medium-sized and recedes slowly to cover.Soft, understated wood tannins combine with very light caramel and toffee malt notes while fruitiness, either from the yeast or the calvados helps brighten things somewhat. Most of the things you¬íd expect from wood-aging are present; vanilla, oak, mild astringency. However, there¬ís absolutely no harshnss, even upon warming, nor any fusels or heavy ethanol. Notes of dark berries, light tobacco, cocoa powder and black pepper all lurk behind the delightful yeast that makes this beer so endearing. Didn¬ít bother reading the description before drinking and was not aware this was calvados-aged. It¬ís subtle and I would not have guessed calvados, though it¬ís obviously not bourbon.Much like the aroma, the flavor is "mild" for its size, with chewy, dry toffee-like malt notes providing a delicious base for the wood tannin and esters to play about on. Ample carbonation still, though not overdone, lending to more drinkability. Vanilla, apples, currants, blueberries and very light brown sugar notes. Alcohol provides some warmth, which seems inevitable at this level, but is never raw/grainy/harsh. I¬íve had issues with calvados barrel-aged beers being very sharp/harsh (see fresh DDB Dulle Teve Reserva) but with this one I couldnt even tell it was calvados.  I think the 7 years have certainly done this well, by the looks of the fresher ratings.  Apple character has faded quite a bit.  Lots to love here; the texture, the relative mildness and the cohesion of all the flavors (and the delightful yeast, of course). Not too much to find fault here and like the regular version, just a stupendous beer.

Bottle at home. 2009 Vintage, 12th April 15. Pours dark, aroma, fruit cake, spice, yeast, biscuit. Taste dark fruit, prune, slight liquorice, sweet caramel, some molasses, oak and vanilla, great complexity. Very nice, better than pannepot

opened with the Lone Pint guys, and Channing on his birthday .. . deep brown purple drapes .. solid foam .. . prune, toffee, dried fruit, and rich dark yeast .. . full, very well done brew .. . . if you watch even one minute of PBS without making a contribution, you are nothing more than a common thief.

Zeer donker bier. Geen schuimkraag. Lekker volle smaak waarbij je proeft dat ze in Calvados vaten hebben gerijpt. Chocolade aroma. Ik was al fan van de gewone Pannepot en deze kwalificeer ik als de Pannepot 2.0. Kortom heerlijk !!
0.33l fles gedeeld bij lion.Geur chemisch fruit smaak cherry cola vanille en hout op de achtergrond. Erg zoet, niet mijn ding

Bottle vintage 2010.
Dark beer with a small beige head, low carbonation.
Tastes like chocolate, spicy, wood, liquorice, alcohol /port, light bitterness and cherries.
Complex beer with lots of flavors, Very delicious.

330ml bottle ate home, bought from the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Dark brown almost black color with beige brown head. Aroma is fruity, dark dried fruits, light wineous, roasted malty, chocolate, wood. Sweet and light bitter taste, malty, caramel, fruity (berries, raisins), chocolate, light wood and alcohol. Medium oily body with soft to average carbonation.
Vintage 2010. Complex beer, with a lot of different aromas and tastes: dark fruits, chocolate, caramel, hints of wood and liquorice. A full warm feel and good slightly bitter aftertaste.
UPDATED: FEB 12, 2017 Bottle Vintage 2010. Pours dark reddish brown. smell of dark fruits, herbs and oak. Taste of plums, oak, berries, caramel. Very delicious and complex beer.

Bottle, 2009 vintage.
Brown-blackish with a espresso coloured head.
Aroma is sweet with raisins, barrel notes, plums and faint alcohol.
Taste is sweet with raisins, slightly oxidized, liquorice, chocolate, light bitterness, spicy notes.
Medium to full body, low carbonation, smooth and then dry.
Warming after taste.
Bue en bouteille de 33cl. Ann√©e 2009. Ar√¥mes caramel, bonbon sucr√©, fruits rouges. Palais complexe, √©quilibr√©, fort en alcool mais qui ne cache les autres ar√¥mes. Merveilleux.

The aroma of butterscotch, yeast and a lot of alcohol. Maybe even a little dark fruits too. The taste is of dark fruits, salt, alcohol and butterscotch. The mixture is suited really not at all. OK bitterness which fills the upper part of the mouth forever. Damn it disgusting beer. This beer is on the brink that I pour it out. (Struise Pannepot Grand Reserva ) Bottle 330 ml at home, served into a small trappist glass, ABV 10%. 
Vintage 2009. Dark mahogany brown colour on the body, clear, with a small sized brown head on top, thin and somewhat fizzy, with low retention. A small line of foam persists arround the glass.
Aroma of port wine, plums, sugars, more dark fruits, black grapes, light alcohol.
Taste follows the aroma, port wine, grapes, lots of dark fruits, stewed red fruits, sugars, faint hints of the alcohol.
Medium thick body, good carbonation, mostlysoft offering a bite at the end, quite dry on the palate.
Very good.
330ml bottle. Black body with no crown to mention. Dark sugars, spices, plums, perries and honey.

Bottle from free beer week curteseoy of spacecoyote and his kind heart. Vintage 2010. Pours murky reddish brown. Nose is big dark fruits, wine amd oak. Tastes of plums, oak, berries, some caramel, florals, hint of tobacco. Smooth and rich. Very delicious.

2010 vintage. Opaque dark brown with a finger-high tan head that quickly dissipates. Aroma is sweet with dried fruits, spices and hints of chocolate. Taste is sweet, dried fruits, dates, caramel, chocolate, lightly roasted, growing bitterness, hints of alcohol. Long, bitter-sweet, boozy finish. Medium-big body, medium carbonation. Tasty!

5.12.2014. Vintage 2009. Very dark brown, slightly oily texture. Intense aroma with dark fruits, plums, malts. Taste is smooth, carbonated (more than reserva), plenty of dark fruits. Warmth of alcohol which is well hidden though.

2009 vintage at OBX in a snifter... Deep mahogany with dark tan head. Dark fruit, plums, raisins, vanilla, toasted oakiness... Taste follows, multilayered, complex, well balanced. Great variation on a favorite Belgian strong ale...

33cl bottle at home. Dark brown with almost no head. Medium to full body with low carbonation. Quite sweet with subtle bitter tones. Roasted malts, dark fruits, vanilla, oak, caramel, brown sugar and herbs. A decent full flavoured brew.
Vintage 2010. Dark brown with minimalistic light brown head. Aroma of locorice. tatse with mild coffee bitterness, some sweetness around, licorice notes. Remaining bitter aftertaste.

I'm amazed over the high point for this beer. 
It is tannic and overly oaked. A bit oxidized (ever so slightly) has an unpleasant bitterness to the palate. This is one of my biggest disappointments.
caramel, chocolate, toast, cereal, resin, alcohol, leather, vanilla, woody, hazy, black, tan foam, medium bitterness, heavy cloying sweetness, full body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish,

A special treat from Peter in Frape - I had the 2012 edition - Very dark red color with thick firm coffee brown head. Sweet herby nose with sherry (?). The aroma is sweet with spices, caramel and malt. The flavor is sweet with dried plum, herbal spices and caramel. Alcohol is hidden, body is thick enough to carry all this complexity. Very nice beer... the surprise starts already when you open the bottle and you smell the aroma.
The beer has a nice dark colour, perfect taste. Very complex, but one of the best ones I had in months!!

The beer has a very dark color, almost black, with a beige head. Aroma of spices, fruit (plums, raisins), and a little smell of wine. These aromas reappear in the taste, combined with some hints of chocolate and coffee and a little smoke in the afterstaste. You can really taste that this beer is matured in wine and calvados barrels. But all these different tastes are so well balanced, which makes it a top class beer.
Grand reserva 2010. Draft version at la capsule, in Lille, France. Also brought back a bottle . Truly amazing beer. One of the best. Incredible complexity. We¬íll balanced but powerfully.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2015 2010 vintage. Pitch black color, average to big brownish head. Malty aroma, some red fruits. Taste of strawberries, malts, hint of chocolate, peach, slightly nutty. Very fruity, smooth, not overly sweet and surprisingly easy to drink. Alcohol is nicely hidden. Full body, soft carbonation. Excellent stuff.

Fantastisk doft av mandel, choklad & russin ton samt vanilj ton av faten √§ven √§pple. Fantastisk smak av choklad, √§pplena fr√•n calvados, vanilj, bitter choklad sitter kvar i halsen, Nice!

De laatste in rating in de Pannepot serie, de Pannepot Grand Reserva Vintage 2009, uitgeschonken in De Struise bierglas. Schenkt uit in een diep donkerbruine, bijna zwarte kleur, met donkere beige schuimkraag die terugvalt naar een fijne ring van schuim. De geur is rijk en vol met met aroma's van rozijnen, appels en vanille. De smaak is net als bij de andere Pannepot bieren complex en zacht met veel smaaklagen. Het smaakpallet bestaat uit tonen van: karamel, gedroogd fruit als rozijnen, maar ook appels, je proeft werkelijk de calvados tonen in deze Pannepot terug! Verder tonen van koffie, eikenhout, aarde, specerijen als vanille en kaneel en drop. De finish is heeft een kruidige en fris bittere afdronk door de gebruikte hopsoorten. De Pannepot Grand Reserva is iets scherper van smaak dan de Reserva variant. Maar door de extra complexiteit van de rijping op calvados vaten is deze variant gelijkwaardig aan de Reserva. Een waar bier meesterwerk van De Struise brouwers.

Rich and complex with some dried fruits, oak, raisins, figs and toffee.[Bottle that kaaz dragged into my house - 2010 vintage]

330ml brown bottle 2010 years vintage, poured into a Tulip glass. Appearance is brownish black with a medium sized tan head that reduced quickly leaving no lacing. Vintage 2009. Coca-Cola, with nice warm brown head. Head dissipates completely. Bubbly seltzer carbonation. Caramel, cocoa, dark fruit notes, light booze. Not as complex as I would have hoped.Where¬ís the belgian yeast I remember?

bottle 330ml, vintage 2009 - Pours dark brown to almost black, with pillowy beige colored head. Foam is falling quite fast leaving a nice lacing on the glass, but after several minutes also this is gone.
Incredible aroma of sour cherries, forrest fruits, vanilla, cherry brandy, dark roasted malt, and caramel.
In taste heavy sweetness with a lot of liquer notes. The taste also reminds me a little bit of some kind of chocolatte pudding my mother used to make in my early childhood. Oak barrels are also slightly noticable. Finish with light bitterness and some warming alcohol notes. Oily texture and soft carbonation create a feeling that you rather want to sip the beer for an hour.
All in all a very enjoyable beer, that in my opinion could be a little bit less sweet.

330ml bottle. 2010 vintage. pours very very dark brown, almost black with a minimal head. aroma is molasses, caramel, bread, malts, yeast and dark fruits. another perfectly smooth beer from struise. alcohol is completely hidden. plenty of dark fruits, lovely sweet caramel/toffee with a nutty slightly yeasty after taste.

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2016 Bottle. 2012 vintage. Pours muddy dark brown with a big brown fizzy head. Aroma is dark fruity, oaky, licorice, yeasty, brown sugar, malts. Taste is dark fruity, licorice, dry oak, chocolate, tannins, malty, brown sugar, yeasty.

33cl bottle, vintage 2009. Pours a very dark, slightly murky brown with a small off white to light brown head. Aroma has lots of dark fig and prune fruity stuff, lots of belgian yeast and dark caramel malts. Taste has a great balance between the sweet, the alcoholic and the slightly acidic fruity yeast and cherry notes. Also hints of roast, chocolate and tobacco. Very nice balance, and alcohol pretty well hidden.
Pours headless with an opaque body. Nose of a whiskey, citrus rind and fig. Perfectly blended after a decade. Candied sugars, plum, rich red wine. Delicious!

330ml bottle. @home 25-01-2014.
Labeled as "Pannepot Grand Reserva Vintage 2009".
BBD: 04-05-2019.
In short: tasty dark strong ale.
Pours quite dark with nice creamy, quite tan head, dense and compact. Moderate head retention, some lacing. Roasty, malty, spicy, liquor, wood aromas. Medium body, average to soft carbonation, viscous texture. This is a robust beer, rich palated, some sweet, raisins and plums, some liquor notes, also some wood and roasty notes. All of them really well balanced, ending in a very smooth and enjoyable dark strong ale. I had it at home during a cold winter¬¥s night, perfect timing!.

Pannepot parallel tasting. 
Pannepot Grand Reserva 2005
Dark murky brown colour with a tiny light tan head. 
Still a bit lighter colour than the Pannepots. 
Dark fruits, plums, sweetness, woody dryness, mild sourness, nougat and chocolate in the aroma. 
Soy sauce, peanuts, dark fruits, papery dryness and dryish malt in the flavour. 
Thin. Almost watery. How can a 10% brew be watery?

Bottle from MOMH. Dark brown, clear, next to no head, syrupy viscosity. Rich fruitcake aroma, dates, tea loaf - rubensaft. Moderate carbonation to lift the stickiness. Rich and roasty initially but then a smack of caramel sweetness, Christmas cake, mixed spice, banoffee pie, mulled wine, apple skins. Absolutely no perception of booze at any stage, perfectly integrated barrel character.

Heel donker van kleur, de kraag bruist enorm bij het inschenken maar is zo weg. Ziet er dan niet goed meer uit. Ruikt zoet, caramel. Smaakt idem met een portachtige bijsmaak. Niet heel veel body. Heel doordrinkbaar, heb ¬ím al leeg. Gelukkig heb ik er nog meer ;-)

2006 vintage. The beer pours dark reddish-brown with a medium off-white head that dissipates steadily to a dense outer ring. Stringy lacing on the glass. Aroma of dark fruit, malt and yeast. Full-bodied with an oaky character and flavors of plums, figs, caramel malt and oak. The finish is fruity with a plum and oak aftertaste. Enjoyable beer all around.

2009 vintage from the bottle, with thanks to bytemesis for bonusing this to me. Sampled next to 2011 Pannepot. Lovely clear brown pour with ruby highlights and minimal head that dissipates quickly. Aroma: bread, dark fruit, caramel, cherry, toffee. Much like a quad. A delicious, delicious quad. Taste is malt-driven, sweet without being shallow or sticky. Minimal bitterness. Palate: full- body; soft carbonation; smooth texture. Overall: honestly these are quite similar - if I had them blind, I couldn¬ít tell which is which. Which is fine because these are both delicious.
2005 bottle, sherry looking pour, medium body. boozy, lots of dark fruits, figs, light oak notes, pretty complex. good flavors. solid

Bottle 2005 Vintage. Cellared for 5 years.
Wow! Does this mature beautifully . If you can lay your hands on some -grab it . All the complexity you expect from Pannepot and much more.
For a beer bottled 7 years ago - as good as it gets.

330ml bottle from Saveur-Biere. Vintage 2009.


Black/brown colour with a creamy light brown head. Spices, dark fruits, creamy, some alcohol and sweetness. Nice but expected more.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2015 Aroma of burned sugar, like creme brulee, raisin, licorice, tarte tatin, apple, wood and vanilla. Taste is very mellowed out and the roasted malt of normal pannepot seems to be close to gone, instead it leaves a more apple pear like quadrupel with solid dark fruit and a bit of citrusy input. The more you drink the more a soy, vanilla oaky characters starts to build up. Can¬ít say I like this more than normal pannepot though.

grand reserva 2009, la mia prima Pannepot....probabilmente aggiorner√≤ il mio commento pi√π avanti, quando avr√≤ preso mano anche alle altre categorie della Pannepot. Comunque l¬íaroma √® legnoso e se lasciato a riposare nel bicchiere per pi√π di 10 minuti si identificano anche aromi di vaniglia...al palato spicca subito un gusto vinoso dato forse dalla doppia fermentazione in botte...sorseggiando si scoprono note di liquirizia con carattere amarognolo e anche un po¬í luppolato!! Forse trovo un po¬í sbilanciato il tasso alcolico....ma probabilmente dato della mia inesperienza! Nel complesso ottima!
Bottle, 2008. Dark brown colour with beige head. Wood, malt, dark fruits aroma, slightly roasted. Sweet, wood, dark fruits, raisin, malt and caramel taste, slightly roasted. Medium to full body.

Quasi-noire, effervescence l√©g√®re-moyenne, col brun clair fin. Principalement malt√©e, moyennement torr√©fi√©e, caf√©/moka, fruits noirs, l√©g√®rement r√©gliss√©e, sucre candi, chaleur d¬íalcool. Tr√®s subtile et tout en finesse.

Pours a dark brown body with a thin head. Rich aroma with tones of bread. Nice and creamy taste with malty tones.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pannepot grand reserva vintage 2009. Diep donker aroma van o.a. pruimen, suiker, mout, kandij, peperkoek. Bijna zwart van kleur met caramelachtige schuimkraag. Diepe volle romige smaak die je werkelijk van je sokken blaast. Je proeft echt de eiken vaten. Je wordt warm vanbinnen van dit bier. Echt het beste van het beste !!!

Vintage 2009 bottle from a SAQ import. Pours a real dark colour with red-copper highlights and a mocha head that stays a bit, leaving a little creamy lacing around. Lots of dark fruits (plum, dates, raisin) in the aromas with a roasted malt base, sugars and some notes of anise. Pretty much the same for the taste, but not as sweet as expected. Alcohol very well-hidden, but mouthfeel is kind of wet and boring. Complex overall, but not my cup of tea (or glass of beer).

2009 vintage, 330ml. Thanks to Robertdale. Dark brown. Lots of dark fruit. Raisin, fig, plum. Slight aweetness. Oak. Doesn¬ít have the banana like Belgian yeast that¬ís typically a turn off for me with this style. super smooth.

2009 Vintage. From bottle to tulip. Aroma of fig, autumnal harvested grain field, black cherry, candi sugar and sweet bubblegum. Pours a near-black brown with cola highlights. Head is dead brown with minimal lacing. Leaves a slight creaminess across the top. Taste is massive dark fruit and plenty of alcohol warmth. Complex layers of raisin and dried prunes. Moderately high carbonation and a sweetness that lingers deep into the taste.

Dark beer with a beige head. Aroma of ginger cookie, dark fruit, medium sweet, caramel and vanilla. Flavour is very nice and complex, caramel with dark fruits, a bit spicy and some fresh hops (Bottle 33cl 2008)

pours unclear dark brown, burgundy tint, with a creamy light beige head, reviving and leaving nice lacing. sweet and pisy plums, dried raisins and caramel soaked in bourbon, light tennessee banana esters, but also apples, very spicy - mint, cardamom, oak, wood - very astringent, sweetness - demerara. lively to average carbonation, light to medium body - oily, very spicy and tannic finish. good tasty stuff, but i still prefer regular pannepot and pannepeut.

Bottle from Bruges. Poured a really dark brown, near black, with a dense beige head. Massive aroma of big dark malt, Belgian yeast, black pepper, oak, leather and berries. Super smooth mouthfeel. Treacle in the flavour, with roasted malt, fruitbread, liquorice and dark fruit. Finish was dates, some earth, bitter burnt, Christmas pudding, chewy malt and alcohol. One of the best.

Pours dark brown with a white head. Aroma of sour, caramel, malts, hints of oak. Taste is oak, which lingers around in the mouth for quite some time. Malts, caramel, hints of banana and an evident taste of alcohol.

Part of a wonderful day in Bruges sampling Pannepeut, Pannepot, Reserva and Grand Reserva. The Reserva is clearly the best, especially in terms of balance of flavours. All must be tried. The wife thought Pannepeut was second best and really should be sought out more.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hauled this 2009 bottle back from Bruges, Belgium. Pours dark brown in my glass with some purple showing in the edges where the light comes through. Small off white head that disappears pretty quickly. Aroma of dark fruits, figs, plums, light molasses and even chocolate, candi sugar. Flavor is sweet plums and figs, molasses, brown sugar, light chocolateyness, and a smooth nuttiness from the barrel. Age showing a bit here with some oxidization going on. Thick body, low plus carbonation, really rich and palate coating. Nice beer but would like to try one a bit fresher as this wasn't nearly the level of Reserva or even the regular version. Still yummy though, which speaks to how good those are.

UPDATED: DEC 6, 2014 Tr√®s bon palais, avec diff√©rents go√ªts d?√©pices. L√©g√®re une fois aval√©, puis l?arri√®re go√ªt arrive avec un go√ªt de calvados m√©lang√© √† d?autres go√ªt . Tr√®s bonne Bi√®re, bien √©quilibr√©. Ressemble par certains aspect √† une bi√®re de No√´l

Bottle 2009. Mixed aroma, hints of stout-like roasted malt and some stronger alcohol which I guess is the calvados oak barrel touch. First impression is its amazing palate. Complex taste, lots of spices with a fruity shade.

vintage 2009 - tasted 2014, schenkt donker bruin met schuimige bruine kraag. aroma van gedroogd fruit, mout, vanille, chocolade, koffie, lichte laurier.. maar niet overweldigende aroma¬ís. smaken zijn redelijk kandij suiker zoet, zeer sterk, stevige donkere fruiten zoals pruim, banaan en rozijn. kruidnagel, laurier, zoethout, alcohol, karamel, drop, chocolade. volle body, romig van textuur, lage co2 en zoetig in de afdronk. een Hell of a beer...ondanks het feit dat ik de reguliere pannepot toch iets lekkerder vind zou ik hier ook graag een kelder vol van willen hebben.
2009 bottle. Black, almost no head. Brandy and dark fruit aromas. Flavor is heavy on the dark fruits. Carbonation low, body medium thin. Drinkable but interesting.

beige head. cola coloured. aroma is boozy, candysugar, yeasty, bit of solvent glue, dark fruits and quad esters. taste like aroma, quite sweet with a roasted bitter aftertaste and slight wry finish. botle 33 cl / bbf may-2019 / 2009 vintage
Pours black with light beige head. Small head. Aroma is fruity, licorice, roasted, banana and coffee. Flavour is roasted, licorice, sweet and fruity.

2009 vintage, 5 years old, pours a cloudy dark brown brew with a medium brown head with poor retention, aroma is moderate to heavy sweet and low bitter with apple, caramel, clove, oak, dried fruits and dark fruits, robust bodied, smooth, good balance, flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and low bitter with a sweet finish and a medium aftertaste, very good, compared with the reserva is mire complex, a bit less balanced, much less acidic, and has stronger oak notes.

Bottle from De Bierkoning shared with esp0r, edvard and Simonsen at The "Esp0r #2000 Weekend in The Woods" 2014. Dark brown redtinted body with a creamy tanned head. Aroma of ripe plums, caramel, sherry, forest berries. Notes of chocolate, vanilla, oak. Taste of dark fruits, sweet chocolate and vanilla, roasted malt, slightly tart cherries, yeast. Hint of alcohol in the finish, with an extremely delightful sherry,chocolate and coffee aftertaste. Awesome!

Small format 2005 brown bottle poured into a glass. Dark brown with small beige head. Aroma is dark candy sugar, meidum body, low carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is a lot of candy sugar, dark fruit, some barrel, and hints of alcohol.  It was good, but I would suspect this was past peak.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2014 Vintage 2009. Dark and strong! Belgian and Barrel-aged (Aged for 14 months on French oak and had a calvados wood finish for anorher 8 months) I loved regular Pannepot Reserva more than this one! (Found it in Malting Pot in Brussels -October 2014)

2009 vintage, 33cl bottle @ home. Pours deep mahogany with a beautiful but quick fading light brown head. Aroma is brown sugar, caramel, wood, chocolate and alcohol. Flavour is medium sweet and slighty bitter. Full body with a creamy texture, soft carbonation. Finish is long with plums, dark fruits and alcohol dominating.

Vintage 2009 version, bottle. Dark mahogany color. Aroma reminiscent of Westy 12: strong wine character, malty, slightly alcoholic. Sweet, malty, dark-fruity mouthfeel, full-bodied. Oaky and vinous finish. Amazing beer.

Vintage 2009. Pours deep mahogany into a snifter. Mocha head with good retention recedes to skim surface. Dark chocolate and pit fruit aromas. Dry with sweet, dark pit fruit and vanilla upfront turning to a warming, earthy roasted nuts and a toasty brown bread finish.

Another superb Belgian strong. Starts with mild but entrapping aroma. Cant really describe in few word things thats going one there. Intense dark fruits, raisins
berries, fresh ripe fruits, apples, plums. Theres quite intense malt background, caramel, light roast, noticeable wood, vanilla. Strong hop presence for Belgian.
Aroma waves comes one after another and you just keep enjoying this awesome brew. Same goes with taste, mostly sweet but with decent bitterness and light sourness. Awesome balance
UPDATED: JUN 14, 2016 When opened- aroma is alcohol, karamel a lot, kkada labaa gumija. After a while taste brings out its characteristics, could be more diversw

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2015 330ml bottle served in my Westy chalice. Grand Reserva Vintage 2006 - PNP No.4. Best Before March 2014. 
A: Pours a dark brown color forming a medium and fizzy beige head with low  retention and only few spotty lacings formed and left in the glass. 
S: Very sweet, candy and biscuity. Strong notes of caramel, toffee, dark dry fruits, dark chocolate and licorice. Bready Belgian yeasts, coffee beans, oak and alcohol. 
T: Follows the nose. Sweet upfront. Roasted malts, yeasts, notes of dark chocolate, dark dry fruits, licorice, candi sugar, coffee beans and oak. Light hops bitterness. 
M: Full heavy body. Molasses. Low carbonation. Dry fruits, licorice and sweet brown bread in the aftertaste.
O: Excellent drinkability. World class Ale. 
[ BA Review @ 5/3/2011 ]
Aug. 22, 12014. Bottle at beerbistro. Vintage 2005. Lovely sweet raisins aroma. Dark reddish black. Very little head. This smells great. Cherry and grape flavours. Refreshing aftertaste. Lovely.

Sweet, dark fruits are checked by light, vinous tannins and mild bitterness. Soft, velvety carbonation somehow gives the impression of lighter body... dangerously easy to drink, considering the alcohol and process behind this beer.
Bottle at Craig¬ís. Pours deep brown, nose is fruity, malty, taste is toffee, berries, fruity.
Flaske fra dags svart farge. . Smaker lakris, kaffe og svart malt . Noe vannete. Mem sv√¶rt god

Together with the Black Damnation series still my favourite beer from De Struise brouwers. Full of flavours. Pours dark brown with a nice beige head. Taste of dark fruits, chocolate, malt, calvados. Should drink it when you have the opportunity! It ages also very well. Great brew!

lots of dark fruits and a bit of chocolate, with a yeast presence that¬ís not overdone...and a bit of booze. maybe the oak mellowed things out a bit. i¬íll revisit this review when i have the "regular" pannepot. this one is quite nice."

UPDATED: NOV 9, 2014 Colore scurissimo, impenetrabile. Schiuma fitta, non molto abbondante e abbastanza persistente, dal color cappuccino con toni dorati. Al naso si avvertono soprattutto sentori liquorosi, mentre in bocca, le note a farle da padrona sono le ciliegie sotto spirito, nonch√© note legnose e di vino liquoroso. Carbonizzazione bassa (la giusta per lo stile). Corpo strutturato e oleoso (scivola molto bene sulla lingua). Meno ricca di sapori della sua "madre", la Pannepot.

UPDATED: MAR 21, 2016 33cl bottle served in a Struise glass. Pours a very dark brown colour with a very concentrated beige head which last quite well. Aroma is hugely complex with raisins, dates, caramel, oak, vanilla and much more that I will want to find the next time. Compared to standard Pannepot, Gran Reserva is clearly barrel aged with additional oaky notes and smoother mouthfeel. Phenomenal.

UPDATED: FEB 20, 2015 2009 bottle purchased at De Bierkoning in Amsterdam. Couldn¬ít wait to return home. Pours dark brown with a nice tan head. Aroma and taste of dark fruit, malt, chocolate, calvados, oak, caramel, and spice. Very, very, very tasty!! Rich, smooth, creamy, and well worth getting one of these.

Bottle (2009) at the Elm Tree, Cambridge. ¬£10(!) but what the hell, YOLO and all that. Murky purple brown, a thin film of light brown head. Pure alcohol, figs, dark chocolate, molasses in the aroma. The taste is a tempered sweetness with just enough bitterness creeping through. Bittersweet muscovado sugar and cooking chocolate aftertaste. Warming alcohol in the finish which envelopes you completely. Dried fruit bittersweet aftertaste. The right amount of tongue-tickling carbonation. Nothing short of incredible.

Pours dark brown/black with a light brown head. Sweet malty taste of dark fruits, oak, hint of chocolate, caramel, alcohol. Oily texture. Creamy mouthfeel. Soft carbonation. Nice warming finish. Great.
Bottle. Dark brown with tan head. Aroma is quite strange, chocolate, licorice and humbugs. Taste of dried fruit, molasses, oak, some sharper fruits. Medium to thin body.
Bottle. 2008 vintage. Pours dark brown with a medium tan head. Lots of dried fruits, raisins, figs, vanilla, some light yeast, some sweet malts, hazelnuts. Heavenly stuff!
Shared bottle at Mi2 15.09.14. 2009 vintage. Black. Pale brown head. Aroma of spices, ash and liquorice. Similar taste. Well-balanced.

Shared bottle at Cardinal. Vintage 2009. Deep mahogany body with a light brown dense film leaving excellent. Vanilla, booze, rock sugar, dark dried fruits. Sweet, pungent malty, alco warm. Silky smooth and full bodied. Dry tongue.

UPDATED: JUN 19, 2017 Bottle shared at Cardinal, Stavanger. Bottle labeled Vintage 2009. Pours dark brown witth beige head. Aroma of caramel, chocolate, dark dried fruits, noe liquorice and alcohol. Tastes sweet with some bitterness. Medium bodied, smooth mouth feel.
In bottle (2009 vintage); aroma is oaky and smokey, with a subtle sweetness. Taste is sweet and syrupy, quite bull bodied with a fruity finish .. overall a very nice beer indeed

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2015 A further elaboration of Pannepot Reserva, with an additional maturing on calvados barrels; first made for √ñlfabrikken in Copenhagen. Pale beige, sticky, creamy head, relatively stable, colour a hazy dark reddish brown. Gracious, powerful and seductive bouquet of chocolate, caramel, walnut, dates, old ¬íjenever¬í, oak, almond, cloves, banana, cinnamon, coriander, old port wine, cider... Soft, rounded palate, dark fruits, very full, profoung maltiness, nutty, caramelly and chocolatey malts, refined sweetness but nowhere cloying, retronasally very woody, tannins, vanilla and warming calvados in a subtle way, further supported by the same drying coriander and aromatic hops as in the regular version; a subtle hint of calvados is indeed noticeable in the finish. Fantastic brew, they even succeeded in improving an already great ale - this version easily belongs to the best beers in its style.  Ages even better than Pannepot and Pannepot Reserva, too: the 2008 vintage, at seven years of age, proved to be more complex, with a slight tart accent and wonderful maderization, than the 2010 vintage tasted the same evening.

330 ml bottle, vintage 2009, Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. ABV is 10%. Very dark brown colour, moderate beige head. Strong aroma of malts, brown sugar, caramel, spices and oak, only a hint of calvados. The flavour seems slightly less sweet than the Reserva, more refined and rounded, still malty with distinct notes of spices and oak, hints of chocolate, vanilla and calvados. A very fine beer.

Vintage 2009. Very very nice. Huge flavor with subtle notes. Nice dark brown with fizzy soft carbonation. Flavor is rich port like sweet marzipan dried fruits coffee and calvados. The flavor sticks to your mouth and stays there for a long time . It is strong warming but not boozy. Great as a dessert.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2015 VINTAGE 2005. Bad bottle. Exploded as I opened it. Taste and aroma werent as expected. Will need to try it again for a better review. Pours dark brown with no head. Cask wood, old, some light fruity aroma. Sweet but dominated by not so good flavors.5/3/5/3/10/26

VINTAGE 2010. Dark brown with no head. Heavy oak aroma with notes of alchool, sweet, dark fruits, a bit of chocolate. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet with notes of oak, liquorice, alchool, spicy, a bit sharp.7/3/7/3/12
Dark brown color with mocca-coloured head. Aroma of dark ripe fruit and caramel. Taste is sublime. Well balanced, diverse and nowhere out of proportions. Very well.

Vintage 2009


Look: Pours with large mocha head, moderate thickness. Very nice, slow retention, leaves a fine, consistent layer, like pancake dough, fair amount of lacing when going down. Darker brown, amber hue (not as dark as stouts).


Smell: Plums! Like plum wine, sherry and lots of sweet dark and dry fruits, from grapes to berries. The medium sweet malt character is made from caramel, milky chocolate and very lovely subtle roast , very suiting and interesting. Also oak and vanilla. 


Taste: Plums are still the most dominating dry fruits, but there are others too. Taste then goes to medium sweet caramel, milky chocolate, candy middle. It is accompanied with light acidity and oak. It finishes with light bitterness, very smooth roast coffee and ends with chocolate lingering in the after. Very small spike of boozy oak at the end with spicy complexity. The spicy complexity is more subtle than in the non-aged ones. 


Mouthfeel: Full, medium heavy body, very creamy, alcohol well incorporated.


Overall: It¬ís a masterpiece, the oak is a subtle gain to the winning formula, but I do miss a bit of the spicy mash-up from the base version of this beer. Overall a bit tuned down but still superb. Every sip is better and different.
Een enorm lekker bier zoals de meeste van deze brouwerij. Aan te raden om eens te proberen

2009 vintage. Pours a murky dark red-brown with a creamy tan head. The aroma is rather vinous, with dark plum and tannins, vanilla, caramel, slightly woody, a little chocolate. The flavor is sweet upfront with apple, caramel, candi sugar, but balanced with woody vanilla notes, chocolate, cherry, and a lightly smoky, dry alcohol finish. Beautiful, my kind of beer.
