Bottle 33cl 2009 vintage. A dark beer with medium head. Nose is vinous with dark caramel and light burnt caramel notes. Aroma is sweet and on blond caramel with vanilla touch, lot of red candied fruits, dry grapes, the same nice creamy and smooth body as other Pannepot versions. Finish is on leather and cigar touch, candy sugar, not that complex though.

2005 vintage.
Pours a great murky dark brown colour. Very complex aroma of fruits and roasted nuts. Taste is also very complex, gets better each sip. Goes down like a charm.

2009 Bottle. Pours a deep red color with a big frothy beige head. Aroma of malt, fruits and caramel. The sweet taste is of malt, coffee, caramel, dark ripe fruits, chocolate, oak, spices and alcohol. Full body and average carbonation. The finish is malty, a bit bitter and with a hint of booze. This one is complex, smooth and very very good.

UPDATED: AUG 30, 2015 Couleur brune sombre, reflet ambr√©s, mousse beige qui disparait. Nez complexe et intense de caramel grill√©, cassonade, fruits secs, vanille, reglisse, note d¬íalcool, pain d¬í√©pice. Gout malt√© grill√©, caramel, prune reglisse, fruits secs, fruits noirs, notes fruit√©es, raisin, tr√®s complexe, huileuse mais bien ronde en bouche. Superbe!

33cl flesje via √ätre Gourmet
Alcoholpercentage van 10%
Uitgeschonken in Grimbergen glas

Uiterlijk: zwart, minimale cr√®me kraag

Aroma en smaak: koffie, chocolade, rozijnen, zoet, bitter. Diepe smaken.

Conclusie: maakt de verwachting waar, lekkere stout. Topper van de Struise Brouwers.



---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle 2009. Chocolate, coffee, resin aroma. Brown head. Taste is very complex with hints of oak. Full body. Want more one...

Bottle 2009, exp. 04/05/2019. A very dark brown beer with an almost medium and beige head. The nose is just great, lots of dark and dried fruits, prune, dates, strawberries, some liquirice and hint of alcohol. Taste has dark fruits, prune, raisins, quite strong herbs, dry barrel, some fresh strawberries. Hint of alcohol in the end but that¬ís not bothering, it should be there. Almost full bodied, smooth and nice to drink. The great beer, a perfect balance and smoothness, very complex.

Color caramelo oscuro limpio con espuma beige. Aromas de caramelo, frutas confitadas, madera. Cuerpo denso, textura sedosa, con inicio dulce y afrutado con toque de acidez y final seco, como madera. Excelente.
Bottle @Bierhuyske. Pours black with fast disappearing beige head. Aroma is caramel and alcohol. Taste is coffee and caramel. Full mouthfeel.

A most generous gift from HogtownHarry. Pours a deep brown pour with a wispy, fast-fading tan head. The aroma is great - intense figgy fruitiness. Dates, plums and some hint of tartness that reminds me of some cider barrel aged stuff I¬íve had in Ontario. Slightly boozy but not in a bad way - it¬ís got loads of oak and warming intensifies this aspect of it. Rich and chewy with a nice balance. Showing some age but is in fine condition.
Vintage 2011. Esplosione di gusti che va dalla prugna e le bacche alla nocciola e caramello, con una torbatura leggera e note di legno maturo e dolce. Stupenda ed elegante!!!

Vintage 2009. Bottle from Geers.

Dark, almost black, with a beautiful red shine to it when held in the light. Quickly disappearing tan head. 

I had the Reserva the day after this, and I must say the second aging on calvados barrels does wonders for this Grand Reserva: the acidity of the French oak is much more balanced and less prominent on the tongue. 

Velvet like smoothness, I only had a real hint of booze (calvados) on the last sip. Hiding its alohol % very well. 

My favourite Belgian beer?.. My favourite Belgian beer.

2005 bottle. I¬íve been holding on to this gem for awhile. Dark brown almost black pour with a tan head. Aromas of figs, oak, brown sugar, and sweet malts. Flavor is similar. Rich and robust finish with no trace of the abv. This has held up tremendously well. Still plenty of carbonation and the flavors are all wonderful, no oxidation to speak of. The best of the Pannepot lineup without a doubt. This beer was a real treat. Delicious.

330 ml bottle. The aroma is sweet with notes of plum, raisins, brown sugar, malt, caramel and alcohol. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, plums, caramel, raisins, brown sugar and an alcohol finish, Smooth.

Bottle shared at S&G tasting with AdamJackson, JefVerstraete, Mathieu87 and others.
Vintage 2008
APPEARANCE: pitch black beer, small unstable beige head.
NOSE: port, sweet, chocolate.
TASTE: port, little oxidated, quite some alcohol, faint coffee.

Botella de 33 cl de zombier, tomada en octubre de 2012 -- pnp no. 4 brown brew-- vintage 2005. Bastante buena. Segun etiqueta-- envejecida durante 14 meses en roble Frecnch con un acabado de madera de Calvados durante otros 8 meses mas. 
Color marr√≥n oscuro con una espuma de color beige cremoso. Aroma picante, suave muy a malta y tiene acentos de manzanas vainilla y frutos secos. El sabor es generoso, tiene notas de frutas caramelo, madera de roble, especias,manzanas regaliz caf√© y l√∫pulos refrescantes. Muy buena y para repetir sin duda, con un alcohol tambi√©n bastante generoso y apreciable en todo momento.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2015 17.04.2014, 0,33l bottle (2005 vintage) @ Belgobaren:
No head, just some bubbles. Aroma is sweet, butterscotch, caramel malts, raisins, burnt caramel, almond cake, dark sugar, oak, spices, alcohol, grass, licorice. Taste is raisins, grass, caramel malts, citrus peel, alcohol, oak, burnt caramel, butterscotch, old rope, spices, hints of licorice and almond cake. Medium bitterness, slightly watery and mineraly mouthfeel. Nice, but maybe it¬ís a little bit over the top?

04.01.2015, 0,33l bottle (2009 vintage) @ home:
6-5-7-4-13=3,5
Nice light brown creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly neutral, yeast, oak, dark malts, raisins, grass, caramel, nuts. Taste is slightly dry mineraly, dark malts, oak, alcohol, minerals, raisins, grass, caramel, nuts, candied sugar, hints of chocolate and coffee. Medium bitterness, slightly dry mineraly mouthfeel. Nice enough.

At Stephens with Stephen and Dave. Pours murky brown. Aroma is some cardboard, figs, raisins, light fruity notes. Taste is some oxidation, silky soft caramel. The beer is right years old at this point, it has really smoothed out, but is slightly too oxydized.

Bottle at home with friends, courtesy of Eric. Thanks man! Pour is murky brown with a small tan head. Big bready, caramel, slightly oxidized, banana, dark fruits, red licorice, figs, and raisins in the aroma. Taste is bread, cardboard, banana, raisins, dates, brown sugar, belgian yeast, and soy sauce. Slick mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Not bad for its age and I can see the potential, but this one is definitely past its prime.

¬í08 Bottle from tiong-thanks! Deep brown with some mahogany red. Nose is initially ginger ale, and cola, becoming more belgian quad-like with brown sugar and prunes. Thinner than I expected. Cola, brown sugar, some dried dark fruit. Not really oxidized, but I think everything is muted here and this is on it¬ís way out.

Pours a rich deep brown with a thinner than expected tan head. The body of this beer is beautiful though. Aroma hits you as soon as you start pouring it into the glass. Pull it closer to your nose and it fills your nostrils with hints of cherry, brown sugar, oak, whiskey, and dried dark fruits. Very complex aroma, very appetizing. Flavor is bold, but not as bold as the aroma lets on. Dark fruits, wood, molasses, cigar smoke, and charcoal flavors are all intertwined in this delicious beer. Also, at 10% abv, the alcohol is expertly hidden in this one. Not nearly as boozy as you¬íd expect. The beer is smooth on the palate and is carbonated perfectly. Not quite as full bodied as I¬íd like but that¬ís nitpicking at this point. Overall this is one of the better beers that I¬íve had in awhile and will probably break into my top 5 "Belgian style" ales. Very good beer.

Rating #1017 - March 7, 2014 - Derek¬ís #botw and #beerguychrisgeekbeer for #week9. Bought 3 of these, one for review and two for the cellar. Dark brown pour with a bubbly tan head, decent retention.heavy on carbonation Aroma is quite fruity. Full bodied. Creamy, buttery mouthfeel. Taste is ripe black currant, raisin, toffee, spiciness. Extremely smooth finish and a lingering taste of sweet malt. Superbly smooth, candy and red wine feel throughout. Fantastic.

Bottled	01/03/14. 2006 Vintage. A purply black coloured beer which pours with no head. A delicious rich thick boozy aroma. Oaky for sure. Molasses and soy. Fruity strong rich and thick in the mouth. Boozy oaky fruity and yeasty. Salty soy notes again. Very enjoyable. A treat..

Pours a cloudy deep brown with a small patchy tan head. Aroma is spicy Belgian yeast, dark dried fruits notably plums, dark candied sugars, and lightly sour. Taste is wood, mildly sour, dark dried fruits, cherries, plums, raisins, spicy Belgian yeast, some wine characteristics and candied sugars. Really digging the light woody/fruity sourness.

Bottle, vintage 2005. Pours dark brown, with a finger thick, creamy mocha head. Aroma is roasted malts, nuts, spices, alcohol and prunes. Full body with soft carbonation. Flavour is malty with plums, oak barrels, spicy hints of aquavit, fruit and kandi giving a quite tart fruity finish.

Vintage ¬í05 on the bottle. Pour is deep brown with a tight tan head. Nose has a ton of rich dark malt, figs, brown sugar, red grapes, a bit oxidized, nutty, cardboard, and boozy notes in back. Taste is also a good bit oxidized. The cardboard is strong with the rich malt being faded. Brown sugar and fig with booze in back. The cardboard lingers through the finish. Medium to full body, fairly good carbonation.

Vintage 2008. Arcy klasyk, swietne i niesamowite piwo. Perfekcyjnie trafia w moj gust, niczego nie moglem sie przyczepic po tym leciwym piwie. Czarne oleiste, moze lekko czerwony refleks gdzieniegdzie sie zauwaza. Zapach intrygujacy, porto, scherry, sliwki trufle i gozka czekolada. W smaku te same wrazenia ale dochodza powidla sliwkowe i zmwlaszcza pieczone jablka, troche rumu i wspaniala rozgrzewajaca koncowka. Wytrawna i dluga. Piana gesta zoltawa ,srednio obfita ale jak na tak mocne piwo utrzymuje sie dosc dlugo, oczywiscie znaczac swoja obecnosc na pucharku. Godne poleceniu wyrachowanemu i doswiadczonemu piwoszowi. Jak najbardziej zalecane piwo do stazenia. Jeszcze raz podkresle, to artyzm i mistrzostwo wazenia i kondycjonowania tego piwa.

Bottle kindly shared by Cuso, thank you! 2008 vintage, 5 years old at the time of drinking. Aroma chocolate, plums, alcohol sting, lightly sour. Dark brown colour. Taste is chocolatey, spicy, only very light sweetness. Alcohol not present in any big amount, as opposed to the 2006 regular version we drank earlier. Moderate bitterness, moderate sweetness, light alcohol. Very good, but sadly overall weaker than the 2006 regular, which managed to impress with a sofisticated complexity. With beers of this age, it was hard to say, if it lacked the 2 bonus years of aging, or something else.

UPDATED: MAY 18, 2017 Drank with Thijs, at a wonderful night (21-12). Not better than regular pannepot in my opinion. Still a great beer though. Small amount of foam. Sweet taste, large hints of wine and small touches of roggebrood. Much depth.

Have had this quite a few times over the years. It √≠s better than the regular pannepot. In general, the older the better.

Vintage 2008. Dark brown/black colour, a lot of beige foam. Moderate carbonation. Complex aroma of roasted malts, dark fruit and some chocolate. Very well balanced. Sweet with bitter finish. Hints of oak. Very good!

Bottle from Kaufmanized, he sent me as win from his charity LIF. Vintage 2008.  Dark brown color with beige head. Coffee, some berries, raisins, sourness in aroma. Taste is surprisingly tart with coffee, raisins, plums, dark chocolate, vanilla, wood. Tart finish. Went nicely with chocolate cake. Tasty.
Bottle by Cuso, many thanks! Bottled in 2008. Overall delicious! A bit sour, a bit bitter compared to the pannepot In had prior this.

Bottle, courtesy of Cuso, many thanks. Vintage 2008. Pours dark brown color, beige head. Aroma is sourish, coffe,red berries, raisins. Taste is sourish, medium sweet, raisins, bitter finish, coffee, chocolate. Nice one.

Serving: Bottle from State Line Liquors. 2005 vintage. It pours a dark, hazy brown with a thin tan ring. Huge nose full of dark dried fruit, vanilla, and calvados. Luxuriant mouthfeel with notes of leather, dried cherries, dark caramel, vanilla, spices, and calvados. The high abv dries things out on the back end. Long finish. Superb beer.

Bottle @ Il Porco, Corbetta. 2008 Vintage. schiuma beige finissima, colore tra il marrone ed il ramato con evidenti riflessi rosso rubino. Aroma molto intenso e persistente. Fruttato (frutti rossi /ciliege sotto spirito) , lievito belga, liquoroso come l¬íAlchermes, speziata, ricorda la liquirizia il cioccolato il legno e in certo modo la zuppa inglese. Molto complessa. Gusto intenso abbastanza persistente. Dolce amabile, poco amaro, solo lievemente acidulo. Dopo il primo sorso liquoroso si sprigiona un fortissimo gusto di liquirizia. l¬íamaro del luppolo √® appena accennato, come da stile. il gusto di valiglia e legno √® pi√π intenso allo scladarsi della birra. Corposa, carbonata e molto rotonda. √© alcolica ma non fastidiosa. Equilibrata e molto armonica. Capolavoro.

2005 Vintage

A: Dark Opaque Hue, Passes No Light, Mild Brown Head Ring, No Lacing

S: Dark Fruit, Cocoa, Vanilla, Mild Maple

T: Raisins, Plums, Maple, Vanilla, Cocoa

M: Average Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Sweet, Mildly Tart

Overall, a nice barrel aged quad with a good, well balanced flavor. Dont go broke buying it but a great pick up for $5.

How: Bottle.
Where: Monk¬ís Struise Bar/Whiskey Paradise, Stockholm.
Appearance: Unclear ruby red/brown colour with a small beige head.
Aroma: Malt, raisin, spices, alcohol, wood.
Body: Full body with a low carbonation.
Flavour: Caramel, malt, raisin, dried fruit, spices.

Bottle at Brasserie V. Unfiltered thick, viscous brown-burgundy. Oily thin residue of a head, but hey, it¬ís almost seven years old. Semi-boozy Calvados aroma, some sweet oaky caramel too. The Calvados barrels really shine, sort of overwhelming at first. Big and a lot of sweet depth. Rather balanced and subdued after a few sips, in a Belgian way. Broad range of barrel tones begin to show, with big, sweet oak and an almost Grand Marnier-like quality of the Calvados. A real quality, memorable beverage. Mellows and the oaky caramel really starts to come out. Maybe one of the better barrel aged Belgians I¬íve ever had, sort of connecting the old school Belgian quality with new school innovation. Quite awesome, World Class.
2005 Bottle on 7/11/2013. So good, I wish I had more to enjoy. Definitely great oak flavors from the barrel aging. Lots of fruit. A fair amount of sweetness. So delicious.

Dark brown pour with a baby finger of offwhite head. Aroma of raisin, fig, oak, red wine. Taste of dark fruits, molasses, fig, oak, biscuit, spice, wood, and brandy. Medium body with lower carb. 2005 vintage.

330 ml bottle bought @ bieresgourmet.be. 2008 vintage. Pours hazy dark ruby reddish brown with a creamy and tiny bubbly brownish beige head that leaves some thick lacing on the glass while dissipating. Smell is sweet, tiny sour and malty with toasted malts, oatmeal cookies, dusty cereal, pears, port wine, moist wood, tingling alcohol, biscuits, grape juice, dates, figs, prunes, caraway, coriander, curacao, dark rum and hints of high quality balsamic vinegar. Taste is slightly sweet, tiny bitter, very tiny tart and amity with crackers, cereal, biscuits, port wine, moist wood, hay, coriander, curacao, dates, prunes, alcohol, grape juice, oatmeal cookies, baked pears, canned peaches and hints of regular low quality red wine. Mouthfeel is round, soft, tiny tart, tiny boozy and medium to full bodied. Finish is tiny sweet, tiny sour and malty with crackers, cereal, biscuits, port wine, dates, alcohol, hay and oatmeal cookies. Excellent beer, I like it more than the regular reserva, atlas when comparing this one to the one bottle of reserva I¬íve tried.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2014 2008. Gorgeous bottle nose. In the glass rich deep oak brown sparkle with a thinish whispy tan head. Firm sappy full body. In the mouth there is molasses, brown sugar and thick rich moreish prune. An effortless high IBU slayer.

2005

14/05/14

More velvety body and a very slight chalkiness too. Effortlessly beautifully intergrated like very few others. Not at tired or wilting. 



2005
15/05/14
More

Bottle to flute
Candied fruit, brandy, raisin, a s brandy. Cloudy amber with a thin tan head. Sour up front that dissipates and transitions to a sweet malty brandy. Light body, thin and silky.

Bottle - Vintage 2005 - I am not going to do this justice. Brown sugar, dates, raisin and barrel notes. Muddy brown with a brown head. Slightly sour dark fruit, red grape and malts. Smell was so robust, flavour although good was not up to expectations. Still a great beer though.

A real contender for the top Belgian Strong Ale. There are so many rich dark fruits among soft oak and tart flavors that only broaden as it warms up. It smells like chocolate, caramel, yeast and calvados with a touch of oxidation. Thanks for the share OmegaX.

Awesome stuff. Thanks Joe. Aroma is big time dark fruits, light oak, fruity sweetness, light Belgian yeast, caramel, dates, figs. Woah. Too good. The flavor is, again, huge on the fruit flavor, semi-sweet, balanced oak flavors, very good. Oh yeah, 2005 vintage!!!
Vintage 2005. Thanks Gabe! Absolutely wonderful! Caramel raisin with dark fruit flavors. Yumm!
caramel, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness, medium body, slick feel, flat, long finish,

330ml bottle at home to oneself. 2008 vintage. Pours dark brown with an off-white lingering head. Lovely tight bubbles. Aromas of apples and wood, demerara sugar and a hint of all-spice. Some of the calvados comes through about halfway down, giving a slight boozey burn. Other flavours include dark stone fruits and vanilla. Lovely and complex beer, but finishes oddly thin for a 10%er.

Pours dark brown with almost no head. Aroma is oak chips, vanilla, muscovado sugar, dates, figs. Taste is dates, figs, muscovado sugar, burnt oak, vanilla, dark fruit. Aftertaste is surprisingly thin. Might have past its best before date.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours dark brown to black with low off-white head. Aroma of muscovado, figs, dates, light molasses, spices, pepper. Taste is boozy and lightly sour, vinous with long port like finish. Body is medium and coarse, sticky, with soft carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle of the 2008 Vintage from Utobeer. Pours opaque very dark brown, off white foam and bubbly head with bubbly lacing that lasts a couple of seconds. Nose is lots of dark chocolate, something like cognac or sweet liqueur, wood barrel, caramel, ale fruity notes like English hop. Taste is ale fruity, sweet apple, dark chocoolate, estery yeasty banana, ripe fruit, dark dried fruits, caramel. Finish is alcoholic woody barrel fortified wine tang with ripe fruit.

33cl bottle 2008 version. wow... the reserva is awesome but this is a masterpiece. pours deep dark with a tan head on top. and the smell! caramel, dark fruits, raisins, a lot of oak smell. taste is just like the smell. lot of caramel, dark fruits, oak finish, small spicy hints of cherry. warm finish of the alcohol. got some bottles left. but they are going to the cellar for another year or so

2008 bottle pours dark brown with a khaki head that sticks around. Man the aroma is big oak and bourbon. But the taste is very complex and held up extremely well. Amazing beer that hides the alcohol very well.
2008 bottle..Pour is dark with a thin white head..Nose is yeast, fig,raisin, spice, chocolate, oak..Taste is chocolate, Spice, light oak, light sweetness,
One of the most complex beers I have ever tasted. It would take me a full page to describe all the different flavors that fight for your attention. Truly brilliant.

2008 bottle. Pours a darker brown with a khaki colored head of foam. Not much retention. Aroma is like a spiced apple with clove, banana, vanilla icecream, some booze. Tastes a bit spicy up front with a smooth malty sweetness evening things out in the finish. Really nice. Much preferred to the regular reserva.

2008 vintage. Pours a deep brown body with a tan creamy head. Laces glass well and subsides to a thin layer. Complex aroma of dates, leather, burnt caramel, liquorice and oak. Wonderful! Taste is a a superb blend of all the aromas. Hard to pull anything i particular out of this, because it seems so well integrated. Dark dried fruits and burnt caramel is evident tho, and the semi-bitter twang of excessive barrel-aging is also there. Body is thick and creamy on the palate, carbonation is soft.

2005. Brune opaque. 
Nez de fruit. Pomme. Banane. Datte. Figue. Raisin. Bois√©. (Ch√™ne). Caramel. Caf√©. Toffee. Chocolat. Sucr√©. L√©g√®re acidit√© venant probablement du viellissement en f√ªt de ch√™ne. Note d¬í√©pice muscade. Canelle. Canneberge. Un peu mad√©ris√©. Note de calvados perceptile. 
Probablement la bi√®re la plus aromatique et complexe que j¬íai bu. Un petit bijou.
Weirdly something. Has power. A beer with power. Bit like cistus a flower with power. Bit like Kirran, a bitch with power. Bit like me, a man with power.

Pours dark, near-black with a minimal head. Aroma is sweet malt with some underlying complexities of dried fruit, licorice, understated candy. Flavor follows - malty, sweet, licorice, but pretty mild, mellow, subtle. Very pleasant.

Vintage 2005 Muddy dark brow and little reddish pour with a brown head. aroma of roasted malts, caramel, red fruit, raisins, liquorice, dark ryebread and herbs/spices. Taste is roasted malts, sugar, caramel, red fruit, spices/herbs, yeast and even some chocolate leading to a dry and woody finish. Really deep and complex...just lovely!
1st rating in a long time. Gotta hit the Pannepots! I love these. Sweet and bit of tart. Lightly fizzy with tart bite out back. Love these beers.
De beste van fe pannepot reeks. Echt superbiertje. Wordt nog steeds gebrouwen ondanks andere berichtgeving.  Bistro nieuwwege voor 1tje te drinken in de west-vloanders

33 cl bottle from Etre Gourmet. 2008 Vintage. Pours almost black with a small brown creamy head. Leaves a nice lacing. Excellent aroma of figs, raisins, plums, roasted malts, dark bread, chocolate, dark coffee and some eartly notes. Perfect balanced. Flavour is the same with new flavors for each zip. Wood and smoke notes as well. Very creamy, and alcohol notes is nowhere to be found. Low bitterness, creamy mouthfeel, low carbonation, long chocolate finish with some sweet notes. Extremely well produced and aged beer. 

2008 vintage. Enjoyed October 16, 2011 Poured from a chilled bottle into a narrow 25cL de Struise goblet. Rich, dark amber - nearly black, with minimal head and no lacing. Nose is extremely rich with roast malt, chocolate, and coffee. Chocolate and coffee are even more present on first taste, with rich dark chocolate taking over soon after sipping. On second sip, dried fruits become apparent. Extremely complex, almost spicy on the palate. As it warms, dark nuts and wood smoke come forward even more, both in taste and nose. Very smooth mouthfeel and goes doen easy for such a high ABV, dark beer. Further warming reveals the alcohol, and lots of peppery spiciness. Dark chocolate stays present the whole time. Slight hints of malt sweetness start to keep through near the end. Phenomenal beer!
Bottled, thx rlgk. Pours black with a small brown head. Smells and tastes figs, raisins, dark chocolate, abit alcohol and roasted malt. Well balance and creamy.
Bottle from Stirchley Wines, Brum. Wowee. Magnificent. So smooth - the burnished caramelised medicinal bitters are creeping, balanced and lip smacking. Easy drinking. Fabulous.

Vintage 2008
Clear dark ruby red colour, tan head. Aroma of vanilla, caramel, malts, chocolate, apple sauce, light madeira and raisins. Sweet malty flavour, chocolate, caramel, light bitter, coffee with milk, raisins and notes of Pedro Ximinez. Full body, finish cacao, raisins, lingering sweet sherry.
Lovely beer!!
(From 33cL bottle shared with friends)

2008 bottle Grand Reserva ¬íVintage¬í 33 cl ("Limited edition of 30HI / 2 year") purchased in Brussels.  This one is a bit too old.  Aroma and flavor is somewhat flat.  Light oxidation is evident.  Oak is character nearly gone, but finish is somewhat brandy-like.  Either handled improperly, or a bit past its prime.  I can taste the potential, though - wish I had it a year ago!

2008 Vintage - Pours a dark red-brown color with minimal head.  The aroma is tight.  Sweet, but not overly complex.  I thought maybe it was too cold, but it never opened as it warmed.  On the palate however, the beer is quite interesting.  Raisins, cola, caramel, and stewed apples make for a decadent treat.  The barrel is only minimally evident.

2008-vintage. Farven er m√∏rkebrun, n√¶r sort. Smaken minner vagt om portvin, og brygget helt latterlig godt balansert. Som fl√∏yel. Toner av toffee og m√∏rk moden frukt. Jeg vet ikke om noe kan smake "estetisk", men denne gj√∏r i s√• fall akkurat det. Bryggekunst.

UPDATED: OCT 16, 2013 Dark tan head. Very mild aroma compared with other pannepots. Taste is rich fruits. Not as much clarity as the basic pannepot. Palate is not too cloying. Nice. Overall, didn¬ít blow me away as expected.

Bottle. Pours hazy dark copper brown with airy light tan head. Dark aroma of malt, caramel and dried fruity with vinous notes. Sour, vinous flavour, giving way to malty sweetness, ending on a roasty note. Boozy aftertaste. Quite Decent.

2005 bottling. Dark brown pour with a very minimal tan head. Barnyard, licorice, brown sugar and stewed prune on the nose. It has such a rich impression. On the palate there¬ís cooked red fruit, molasses and brown sugar and myriad other things, leather. Incredibly complex. The body is pretty full and silky smooth.
Grand reserva 2008. Dark brown colour. Sweet port-like flavour. Thanks to jimmythespoon!

2005 bottle. Pours a crisp black. Not as murky looking as the regular. The smell isn¬ít as pronounced as the original hints of oak and a bit of sweetness. Wow again I get a wine after taste but this version is way smoother with less sweetness and more of the wine aftertaste. Tastes completely different than the bottle of the original I just tried.  Cool. But think I like the original better.

Grand reserve 2008. Was waiting a while to try this and it was my first birthday beer of this year. Wow what a beer. Super smooth, very nice beige head, aroma was lacking a little though but overall this was a great beer.

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2013 2005 vintage, drank in 2013. No head. brown and muddy look. aroma of prune, licorice, brown sugar, raisin and pudding. it gets more complex as it opens up. Rich creamy brew with molasses flavours, toffee and stewed dark fruits as well. it has a crazy long finish. Amazing brew! Very happy to have tried this one!

Rating #500
Pours dark dark brown with no/low yellow/white head
Aromas of liqourise, oak barrels,special b malts, hints of caramel, alcohol.
Oh my god! Perfect palate. Round medium sweetness, full of licorise, hints of figs, dades, dark fruits and belgian yeast. Start out quite spritzy which moves over to a lovely very fine tuned sweetness which then moves in to a subtle lingering bitter finish.

UPDATED: SEP 28, 2015 Color : dark brown beer with no carbonation and medium heavy brown head. Smell : malt, great complexity of sugar, cane, caramel, resin, wine, marzipan. Taste : malt, wine, with nice bitterness, sugar, peat, red fruits. Aftertaste : malt, and resin.

Bottled. Dark brown colour with a beige head with minimal to medium lasting. Aroma has red fruits notes, dominating berries, toasted malts, caramel, raisins and ripe fruit. Flavor is sweet from the beginning to the end, notes of berries and raisins are present, candy and brown sugar, notes of red apple, toffee, yeast and caramel. The final is sweet with a light alcoholic sensation that is hidden by caramelish notes.

Bottle sample at a tasting at kerenmk¬ís place. 2008 vinage. Thanks Nimrod. Pours brown with a beige to brown head, aroma of grapes, raisins, malt and alcohol, flavor of plums, grapes, metal, spices, lively carbonation, medium to full bodied

Bi√®re d¬íexception ..Du haut vol ..! ar√¥me pommes alcoolis√©es calvados, sucre cassonnade,.; quel palais tapissant toute la gorge avec ces notes doucement √©pic√©es; du caramel,caf√©, toast grill√©..On d√©guste avec d√©lectation et chaque larme de ce doux breuvage me laisse p√©tri d¬íadmiration ..Merci!

Bottle. Black with a creamy tan head. Aroma of chocolate, roasted grain, brown sugar, raisin, calvados, and vanilla. Thick sugary sticky palate. Tastes of fig, raisin, calvados, chocolate, brown sugar, vanilla, apple, and oak with a dry alcoholic finish.

Bottle sample at a tasting at our place. Thanks Nimrod. Pours dark red, opaque with tan head. Wood, resin, a little alcohol and acetone. Pleasing liquor-like sweetness and a full, warming body. No carbonation, syrupy. Ages well. 2008 Vintage.

Bottle 2008 vintage. Bought this some time ago and have only just got around to drinking it. The wait was worth it. Dark brown with a small head.Lovely port like flavour with a gentle creaminess running through it.
Amazingly smooth for its strength-wanted the bottle to last forever.
Brilliant.

Vintage 2005.  Sweet herbal aroma (Jagermiesterish) some spice and apples, dried fruit and oak.  Pours a dark translucent brown.  Lots of fig newtons and more herbs followed by a touch of smoke.  Overall, wow a totally awesome brew... Many thanks to BarZigKin for sharing!

2005 Bottle
100th Belgian Strong Rate! First rate of 2013! 

Pours a very dark brown, with ruby hues when held up to the light. The head is big and tan and fluffy, leaving a nice lacing on the glass. 

The aroma is rich but earthy, strange and intriguing. It¬ís largely fairly subtle, more so than a dark strong Belgian beer usually is. But it¬ís very enjoyable, nice pear and dark cherry fruit notes. Toasted nuts & a well finessed woodiness.

The flavor is very woody, but in a well rounded way, not brash or overbearing at all. The roastiness is mild and with the help of some light alcohol this makes for a bold and warming beer. The nuttiness and spiciness show up more mid palate and follow through the finish. As it warms the beer becomes sweeter and has more dark fruit & vanilla. Nothing is overbearing, nothing is out of place, I can say this seems to have aged very well... but I¬íve never had a fresh example as comparison. I will say that this has basically no apparent oxidation issues or any other "old" character. In fact I¬ím a little surprised that it¬ís a 7 year old beer.

2006 Bottle from De Bierkoning, Amsterdam. Rating #1500, a treat. Stunning blackest rich body, gushing big bubbly head that settles. Rich apple-pear brandy nose, with chocolate, red fruit somehow still refreshing. Great leathery note behind the apple sweetness, just compounding the impressive balance. Pear, raisons, smooth chocolate. complex, sweet, well balanced and firing in all areas. Super tasty, stunning really.
Bottle to oversized snifter (2005 vintage).  Looks good; a cloudy cola with beige lacing.  Smells solid; dark fruit, oak, and Belgian yeast.  Tastes like it smells with a good mouthfeel.  Good beer!

[Botella de 2008] Esta cerveza de color oscuro tiene una espuma que desaparece r√°pidamente dejando una ligera capa cremosa como la de un caf√© spresso. Me huele a flores y frutas frescas. El sabor es muy complejo, con tonos dulce y picante como la pimienta, con toques a caf√©, canela, hierbas, toffe y vainilla. El paladar exquisito. Te llena toda la boca de sabor y aroma. Mejor no muy fr√≠a. La presencia de los 10% de alcohol va haciendose notar poco a poco.
Una delicia para cualquier noche de fr√≠o invierno.

2006 bottle. Huge (huge!) thanks to Matt for finding, splurging on, and hauling this back from Amsterdam. Pours a murky very dark brown, with a good amount of sediment. Aroma is like chocolate-covered dark fruits, with brown sugar and a bit of baking spices. The calvados is a wonderful counter, providing just a hint of an apple zing, but it isn¬ít strong after 6 years. Just enough to team with the alcohol and provide a wonderful balance to what would have been a very sweet beer. It has an extremely pungent aroma, a silky smooth mouthfeel, and a stunningly balanced flavor, which also includes some mild leather and . Every sip leaves you wanting more. This is unbelievably delicious -- I really don¬ít think I could like a quad better than I like this. I¬íd take it over a Westy 12 any day of the week. Phenomenal.

2005 vintage (first ever I think). Brown brew as per bottle with a small white head that doesn¬ít linger too long. Aroma is full of sweet candi syrup and almost no barrel notes (I would have thought it would be a barrel bomb but it isn¬ít...). Mouthfeel is watery compared to the regular Pannepot and carbonation is low-medium which is nice. Taste is sweet with a sour edge. Flavors of molasse and again close to none Calvados notes. The sourness must come from the barrel though and maybe Calvados just doesn¬ít blend well with this kind of brew. It is good and enjoyable, just not meeting my somewhat high expectations for a barrel aged Pannepot. Might be because it was bottled in 2007 too.

Bottle at home in London with Lyoli on NYE. Pours clear, rich brown with a tight, creamy tan head. Lovely, smooth dark candi sugar nose, some hints of chocolate, dark bread. Medium to big sweet flavor, more dark candi sugar, some light dry, woody character, well roasted malts, earthy bitterness. Medium to full bodied with fine, smooth carbonation and a vinous mouthfeel. Light dryness to finish, dark malts, burnt sugars and burnt wood, dirt, hints of dark fruits, raisins and plums. You really can¬ít tell this beer is anywhere near 10%. Quite dynamic and well rounded.

Bottle at Rich¬ís house, cheers for organising the tasting!2005 vintage
Cola and caramel on the nose. Boozy and sweet at first with a sour soy sauce note developing and a metallic finish. Possibly past its best.

Bottle, 2005 vintage. Pours opaque deep brown to black, small brown head that dissipates quickly with a bit of lacing. Aroma is dried fruit, prune, port, molasses, wood. Flavor its the same, quite complex, medium sweet. Full bodied and creamy. Prickly carbonation. Faint warming finish gives away an otherwise well masked ABV. Quite nice.

2005 Vintage, bottle at home thanks to Craig Garvie - 11/12/12 (PNP No.4).
Pours a murky mahogony brown with a thin tan head that dissipates to cling to the edge for dear life in a bubbly way and leaving a small friend called film in the centre.
Nose comprises raisens, dried fruits, dark malts, touch of wood, grandads shed mustiness, plummy, prunes, figs.
Taste is a complex blend of dark fruits, raisens, dark sugars, prunes, 
Full bodied, fine carbonation, massages the palate - excelent feel !
Great beer, well balanced, complex, big splashes of dark fruit all over the place!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 2008 VIntage. Pours a rich black umber color with a thick frothy khaki colored foam. On the nose its soft and inviting with nice notes of wet wood, herbal earthy spice, dark fruit and a touch of dark bitter chocolate. On the palate its continues with a mysterious complexity and balanced harmony that the nose hints at. Rich flavorful beer with amazing mouthfeel and a real palate pleaser from start to finish. I wish i could have one of these everyday i get home from work it truly is a perfect beer !

Bottle 330ml. [Vintage 2005]
Pours dark brown with low beige head. Some lacing. Aroma is of dark fruits, bread, malt, caramel, alcohol. Taste is of dark fruits, malt, caramel, sligth acidity, warming alcohol. Palate: Medium body. Overall: Easily drinkable. Pretty good, but not awesome. Possibly too old.

Robe brun fonc√©, aux reflets bourgogne. Ar√¥me de caramel, fruits noirs, malt et noix. Au go√ªt, on ajoute des notes d¬íalcool, de vin rouge et de bois. Mince en bouche. Oxydation. Bonne bi√®re, mais j¬íavais de plus grandes attentes.

Bottle (330 ml) vintage 2005. Traded by dresden, thanks Steve! Dark amber with a small beige head and some lacing. Aroma is incredibly complex with strong caramel notes, dark fruits, nuts and wood. Taste doesn¬ít live up to the expectations created by the aroma... dark fruits, wood, slight caramel, but also signs of oxidation, including and slight acidic presence. Mouthfeel is thin, slight vinous and acidic. I think this bottle is too old or had a slight problem per se... but this is still a very good complex brew and I can see why this is rated so high. I will have to taste it again.

2008 vintage.  Enjoyed October 16, 2011

Poured from a chilled bottle into a narrow 25cL de Struise goblet.  Rich, dark amber - nearly black, with minimal head and no lacing.  Nose is extremely rich with roast malt, chocolate, and coffee.  Chocolate and coffee are even more present on first taste, with rich dark chocolate taking over soon after sipping.  On second sip, dried fruits become apparent.  Extremely complex, almost spicy on the palate.  As it warms, dark nuts and wood smoke come forward even more, both in taste and nose.  Very smooth mouthfeel and goes doen easy for such a high ABV, dark beer.  Further warming reveals the alcohol, and lots of peppery spiciness.  Dark chocolate stays present the whole time.  Slight hints of malt sweetness start to keep through near the end.  Phenomenal beer!

Bottle¬ís from Belgium in a Box; 2005 Vintage ¬ñ Dark brown colour, sweet malt aroma, taste very complex with loads of fruit raisins, plums, sultanas. There was however an unpleasant metallic taste. 2008 Vintage ¬ñ Similar pour, this once taste more pleasant didn¬ít have the same metallic taste. Went down really well on a cold autumn night.

Thanks to fredrik and Ludvig!
2008 bottle.
Very dark reddish brown with a beige head.
Aroma: malty, sweet licorice, apples and calvados, light chocolate, vanilla.
Taste: Basset¬ís Liquorice Allsorts and other sweet licorice, chocolate, malty, fudge.
Full bodied.
Wow, this is tasty! 
2005 bottle.
Aroma: chocolate and lots of vanilla, less licorice than in the 2008.
Taste: vanilla, cherries, rowan berries, licorice, more sour than the 2008, also some sort of sour candy.
Medium to full bodied.
On its own, the 2005 bottle would receive a lower rating due to the sour red berries in the taste. Nothing wrong, I just prefer the other. (8-9/4/8/4/16=4.0-4.1)
Pours an almost black with no head. Nice and carbonated. Aroma is chocolate, oak some alcohol. Taste is same with some sour notes as well.

Bottle at tuulensuu, tampere. Dark brown color with smooth white head. Aroma of licorice, blum, oak, sweet malts. Nice balanced taste, licorice, oak, blum, caramel. Balanced, strong and delicious. Bottled 2009.

350mL bottle from the De Struise bottleshop. 2005 vintage. Drunk 10-10-12, reviewed from notes.

A: Coffee black. Thin creme lacing. No legs. 

N: Plastic, biscuit, rose, alcohol. Raisins, plums, and prunes. Cola. Vanilla and tannins. Very complex and sweet. 

T: Lots and lots of oak. Very biscuity with a touch of prune and raisin. Lots of bitter herb/cola. Rather surprised this isn¬ít more sweet.

M: Not as quite as round and full as Pannepeut. Lots of alcohol here. 

O: A solid beer, if not as good as it¬ís brother. Worth a shot, but I¬ím not sure if this is better fresh.
2008 Hazy dark brown with brown head Taste  is malty, some sugary Fizzy palate.

Bottle from 2005 thanks to Dany.  I think he gave me this one in exchange for some suntan lotion which he ended up rubbing into his eyes.  Pours a deep brown with a bit of haze and the faintest tinge of a beige head around the edges of the glass.  Huge sweet plums and prunes on the nose, lots of malt, sticky and sweet.  Medium bodied, full of sweet malt, a touch of oxidization, warm yeast, a lovely prune and plum sweetness.  Warms a small touch on the finish, but super mellow.  Very slow spicy yeast lingers.  Lovely.

October 31, 2012 bottle from binnys I think. Dark brown pour with big head that faded relatively quickly and lacing. Aroma was dark fruit, alcohol and belgian yeast, wood came out as it warmed. Taste had a lot going on but maybe too much. Wood and alcohol seemed to dominate, but then there was a funky spice and some sweetness followed by a dry finish.

Bevuta alla Pecora e il Luppolo di Mosciano S.Angelo(TE). Birra dal colore marrone scuro con schiuma color nocciola.Rispetto alla Pannepot base a aromi e sapori pi√π complessi dovuti all¬íaffinazione in botte. Nonostante i suoi 10¬∞ scende gi√π che √® una meraviglia.

330ml bottle with 2008 stamped on the label. Dark pour which manages to sustain a head for a few minutes. Thick notes of chocolate with an additional cognac fruitiness jump out of the glass. Tastes very rich and decadent, with figs, plums, cherries, chocolate and treacle notes. The barrel certainly doesn¬ít dominate or overwhelm, instead complementing and enhancing the base beer as it should do. A little burn towards the finish. Classy and superbly balanced stuff from Struise as always.

Bouteille de 33 cl, √©dition 2008. Ar√¥mes complexes de fruits confis, de ch√™ne et de pommes cuites. Robe bourgogne et plut√¥t limpide, effervescence moyenne et l√©g√®re dentelle. En bouche, on retrouve un caract√®re malt√© complexe d√©veloppant des notes de fruits confis et une belle pr√©sence de ch√™ne et de pommes caram√©lis√©es. Plut√¥t sucr√©e et assez lourde en bouche. Longue finale malt√©e et l√©g√®rement alcoolis√©e. Petite touche m√©tallique en arri√®re-go√ªt. Int√©ressant et original, mais je pr√©f√®re les bi√®res belges plus s√®ches.

Bottle at home. Vintage 2008. Pours a very deep and slightly hazy reddish brown colour with a medium creamy beige head. The aroma has a lot of dried fruits and raisins, a long with cocoa, oak, leather, nuts, coconut, port, licorice and alcohol. Powerful flavours with oak and leather being the most dominant. But here¬ís also dark berries and more cocoa, and with an alcohol warmth in the end. Soft and rich mouthfeel, and a light bitterness. A wonderfully complex beer all in a fantastic balance, like a small fairytale through my mouth.

2008 bottle @ home. Rating 1400! The pour¬ís deep brown with red highlights, medium tan head that settles. The nose is rich and complex. Loads of bubblegum, chocolate, spicy wood, caramel, roasted nuts and hints of coffee. Light red berry vinous notes. Nutmeg. Great aroma. The taste is spiced cherry jam, earthy chocolate malt, loads of runny caramel and roasted raisin bread.  Light red apple, some wood. Light tang. The body¬ís amazingly smooth, just a hint of booziness suggests the fat ABV. Overall, a fantastic brew. I¬íd love to drink this right alongside the regular edition of Pannepot. This is great, though not a complete game-changer in the way Pannepot was for me. Still, why didn¬ít I buy more of this?

2008 bottle. Pours deep deep brown with tan head that deflates to a thin layer  aroma is deep and rich.  Boozy fruit cake.  Oak leather vanilla coffee notes. Taste is huge complex mix of caramel, toasted malt , fruitcake , muscovado sugar , sour cherries , oak all in perfect balance.  High carbonation suits very well   Alcohol is  very well hidden , only appearing as a pleasant warm afterglow   

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle from Utobeer, London
2008 vintage, BBE 16/08/2016 - Pours dark brown with a nice brown foamy head. Aroma of dark ripe fruits, malts, sweet syrup, hints of oak, smoke and wood. Taste is sweetish malty with some spices, dark ripe fruits and hints of oak, syrup, yeast. Finish is sweet and sticky with some malty notes and hints of oak and spices. Nice, quite tasty and well aged dark Belgian ale.

On 33 cl bottle, vintage 2008.
Black/ dark brown color, some foam.
high intensity aromas of  chocolate , malt, dried,fruits, licorice
Full body & high complexity.
Some sweetness, but well balanced. Still good carbonation and long lasting aftertaste.
Powerful and Very enjoyable

From a bottle, vintage 2005. Dark murky cola pour with short lived tan head. Aroma of raisins and licorice. Plenty of carbonation in the mouth. Light caramel and dark fruits with a lingering bitter finish.  A very tasty beer.

Bottle with Jose. Poured a cloudy dark brown color with restrained carbonation and head. Aromas of figs, caramel, oaky calvados wood, leather and dark fruits. Taste is a perfect balance between sugary and roasty flavors with some nice oak, toffee crunch, light hops, and prunes. Nice and warming in the belly. Full flavored and extremely lasting belgian strong. Awesome, I enjoyed this one more then the regular pannepot and reserva.

A-- Poured a light cola color and settled a dark brownish ruby color. One finger light orange brown head that slowly died to a solid collar. Upon receding it left a half streak of lacing on the glass. Nice head retention to this. 

S-- Oak, vanilla, brown sugar, raisin and I would swear spiced orange. Not a big nose but a good solid nose. 

T-- I would say a spiced rum fruit cake cake really. Brown sugar, vanilla, dark fruits with orange splashed in, slight amounts of rum and toasted oak. Slightly thin but really nice. 

M-- Slightly thin in the front but quite coating in the back. Low carbonation and medium body. Back of the palate is quite solid. Lots of brown sugar and raisin. Finishes with a nice oak kick. Solid stuff. 

O-- Has held up quite well. Happy to have one other to drink. Slowly getting back into quads and this helps the cause a lot. Well hidden alcohol and just a well balanced beer
Vintage 2006 at Belgobaren, Sthlm september 2011. Brown beer with a beige head. Fruity, sweet, pineapple aroma. Raisins, sweet, dried fruits. Really a nice beer :-)

Fles uit 2008. Kleur zwart met af en toe een vleug amber. Licht bruine kop die haast geen lacing overlaat. Smaak van kandij suiker, koffie, aarde, brood, vanille, fruit als in pruimen en vijgen. Fantastisch biertje, een van de beste die ik gedronken heb.

Aldus Huubs.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

600th beer rating! 11.2 oz bottle from PremierGourmet in buffalo NY. Pours a dark light syrupy pour of dark murky red with light orange hues. Big fat aromas of caramel, fig, cherry, plum, (wow theres just a lot of complexity in the nose and its hard to note them all), and bread. Flavors of plum, fig, alcohol( not to strong), cherry, bread, oak/light wood, spice and caramel. The flavors have really mellowed out and have a good balance between all of them. The alcohol does come through more than I wish it would have, as it takes away slightly from the enjoyment of this wonderful vintage. The aromas really are wonderful. Medium sweet, slightly dry, slightly bitter, medium complexity, light spiceyness, light acidity and noteworthy. Still I think all around I enjoyed the other pannepot a little better. Very glad to have tried. Truly a desert!
Color is dark brown with low head. Aroma is roasted malts, dark fruits and alcohol. Flavor is dark fruits, roasted malts and syrup.
Pours hazy dark brown with a low tan head. Aroma is roasted malts, dark fruits and alcohol. Flavor is roasted malts, dark fruits, brown sugar and alcohol. Quite nice.

bottle at de kelk and struise shop ( both bruges) 
i still like pannepot better.. this is smoother, something more complex as well, but the little bit in your face that the pannepot had is just gone.. if you like pannepot i would definetly recomend to try this one, but it just doesnt beat pannepot to me ..

PGR 2008. Dense foam. Had some barley wineish characteristics in the flavor which, in my mind, distinguished this from many other Belgian strong ales. Super duper smooth on the palate. Lots of yeast sediment. Overall an excellent beer. Not a surprise, since this is what I expected. I hope I get to enjoy this many more times in the future.

Mild but very intriguing aroma and beautiful almost purple pour with an incredibly balanced taste and very satisfying mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance: old woods with little to no head and a small bubbly collar ¬ñ not flat, just rested. Appearance of age and gentile sophistication. Poured slowly as to avoid the dregs resting at the bottom.

Nose: sophisticated and matured. Dark fruits and stones ¬ñ raisins and prunes especially. Chocolate is a delicate blanket. Cherries in the back ¬ñ fleshy first followed by stone tannins and nuttiness. Gentle whispers of port and port-soaked leather sacks.

Palate: yum! Gentle vanilla, caramel, and chocolate nougat melted together atop plums, prunes, and raisins. Absolutely harmonious. Oak is a ghostly essence ¬ñ a silent humble gentile partner. Full and light. Leather and cake ¬ñ subtle chocolate velvet cake. Spicy heat and oak tickles the back of my throat. Cherry, oak, and port.

Final Thoughts: this beer was A.M.A.Z.I.N.G. If I could drink this wonderful beer every day, I would, and it would be A.M.A.Z.I.N.G. every single time. Sophisticated. Gentle. Complex.

2008 vintage. Lots of dark fruits: raisins, plums. Licorice, bitter chocolate, a distinct tangy oak, vanilla, bourbon. I really like the flavor brought by the Calvados barrel aging; I¬ím in the minority, but I prefer this by a slight margin to the regular Pannepot.

Bottle shared by drabmuh. Thanks Matt!

This beer appears a dark brown color. There is an off white / tan head that fades to about 1/4 inch and holds. Spotty lacing encompasses the circumference of the tulip glass. The aroma is of an authentic Belgian quad: yeasty, bready, enticing. The taste is incredibly smooth and delicious. Five years of age on a well crafted quad does some wonderful things. There is a slight hint of alcohol in the finish, but it only serves to add a warming sensation to the finish, enhancing, not distracting from the overall taste profile. What a great beer. I¬ím glad to have sampled it.

33cl bottle poured into wine glass. Vintage: 2005 (Lot A C BB). Enjoyed next to Pannepot (2010) and Pannepot Reserva (2009). Deep tan (almost drown). Single (soft khakis) fingernail head on medium pour. Smells of cinnamon, all-spice, fig, vanilla, oak, and caramel. Oakiness (and the barrel character) is very pronounced and the aromas are wonderful! Loads of oak/barrel up-front followed by ZING of spice and dark fruit. Touch of caramel and vanilla finishes this one off. Of the three, this was - hands down - my favorite. The beauty and depth of this beer is unique, wonderful, and amazing. Age has down wonders to this beer and I think it will get better in due time. Nice work Urbain - bravo!

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2013 Notes from July 2012

2005 bottle. Dark almost opaque brown with a dark brown diminishing fizzy head and lace.  Aroma starts simple bread and yeast then goes sweet boozy raisins and figs, spice and herb notes.  Flavor is moderately sweet raisin bread with a little tang early, later moderate bitterness  with wood and chalk taking over. Silken soft gives way to a dry tannin end.  I don¬ít get much Calvados but the booze is easy enough.  Seriously complex, rich and deep beer that draws you in at each raise of the glass.  A special occasion in itself but worthy of a celebration.

Revised notes from 1/1/13.  At 7 years it¬ís still drinking wonderfully but next to the 2009 Reserva their is noticeable dead yeast component that may be a sign it is past it¬ís prime. It¬ís considerably more rich though more mellowed and oxidized.

Bottle. Moderate to heavy toasted and dark bread for the malt, light herbs for the hops, moderate earth and dough for the yeast, with notes of raisin, dark rum, fruitcake and faint tobacco. Head is small, fizzy, tan with a few spots of lacing and is mostly diminishing. Color is very dark brown. Flavor starts lightly to moderately sweet and moderately acidic, then finishes lightly to moderately sweet and lightly acidic and bitter. Palate is medium to full, a little slick with a soft carbonation and a moderately alcoholic finish. A tasty Belgian Strong Ale in perfect balance. Mostly like the other Pannepots with just a slight difference.

2005 vintage. Pours opaque, tan head. Aroma of dark fruit and some toffee/cocoa, but more reserved than the 2007 Pannepeut consumed just prior. Carbonation is outrageously soft and supple. Some dark fruit on the palate, but the oak flavor seems to be muting the fruit and adding some, well oaky and woody/alcoholic notes. I¬ím not really getting much of any calvados, maybe a hint of brandy on the finish, maybe. A great beer, but in truth the oak isn¬ít really necessary and takes away from the beer¬ís overall flavor.

Big thanks to Hog Town Harry for this 2005 vintage. This beer is like nothing I¬íve ever had before. Pours with a creamy head, slightly viscous lacing. The smell reveals slightly soured cherries, raisins, alcohol and apricot. The sourness builds a wall around my mouth on sipping, a slight, thin, pleasant tartness that gives this beer a real individual character. Wasn¬ít what I was expecting, and it¬ís damn good for it. Sourness hangs around for a good long palate with a surprise of light anise at the end.

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2017 Grand Reserva 2008. 33cl bottle. - Quite a full and tasty step or 2 up from the regular Reserva due to its fuller, creamier mouthfeel (while retaining the unusual but typical heavy Belgian carbonation) and reduced sugar content, giving way to a very rich, seamy and drinkable dark chocolate quality, which makes this a great dessert (no real dessert needed to go with it). Normally not a big fan of the spicy and sirupy Belgian dark ales, but this is redeeming its pedigree. Almost as rich and satisfying as a good Imperial Stout... // 2010 vintage, opened 2017-2: basically thinned out fizzy pear syrup with ample residual sugars over the fizzy oak. Not much of a fan of thrse anymore, Mum is....

vint 2008: almost no head. dark brown. nose  with hints of calvados, candis, brown sugar. Not so heavy as expected. Semifullbody and som elength. Taste is soft sugar, candis and brown sugar with a clear reminiscens of applebrandy. Tastefull and it bears its 10 % very fine - it is very easy to forget the strength.

330ml bottle.  Pours very dark brown with a small head.  Aroma is raisin with some woody, bourbon notes.  A little sherry, too.  Taste has rich raisin and blackcurrant to start.  Bitter liquorice finish.

22-JUN-2012, bottle @home, from "√òlbutikken", 2008 vintage. 
Dark brown with lasting low tan head. 
Chocolate, brown sugar, dried fruit, figs. But also oak and cognac. Quite alcoholic but not burning in any way. Carbonation is a little below average but still very lively for a five year old. Quite sweet. 
Very fine drink.

Vintage 2005 bottle. Dark brown / light black pour with a 1 finger tan head that settles down quickly. Sweet nose with layers of oak, apple, dark fruits and brandy. Med body with brown sugar, dark fruits, brandy, oak, vanilla and tart cherries. Warming finish with dark fruits and vanilla.

Dark brown with nice head. Aroma complex with chocolate, caramel, roasted malt, dark fruits. Taste complex with sweet roasted malt, dried fruit, chocolate, licorice, alcohol. Full body, text smooth, alc notable. Finish chocolate bitter. Reminds me of a good porter.

Aroma- figs, cinnamon, plums, oak, cloves, sherry, cherries
Appearance- murky brown with a thin white head
Taste- oak, caramel, booze, cinnamon and other spices, molasses
Palate- full-bodied, moderate carbonation, smooth mouthfeel
Overall- For as old as this brew is, it held up pretty damn well.  Very sweet, very filling, this is a special Belgian.  One of the most complex smelling/drinking beers that I¬íve ever had.

Pours a dark maroon red, slighty cloudy, with a fizzy head that disappears quickly. Seems darker and cloudier than its younger sibling.

The aroma is incredibly powerful. Gobs of cherries and woodsy vanilla. A smoky and dense theme is apparent. Almost has a port-like quality. More mature than the regular Pannepot. More umami-esque. Some subtle mushroom flavors. Just slightest hint of funk, leathery, maybe even a little cheesy. Seems deeper, more complex. As it warms, armagnac-soaked prunes appear.

I take a sip. Wow. Big. It¬ís still a bit cold but the beer goes through several stages on the palate. This beer is a boxer landing a big blow right off the bat. Smoky, deep, rich. Cherries still appear, but the fruit recedes behind a layer of tobacco, alcohol and oak. The sweetness is present but has mellowed out. Tannins are present on the mid-palate. And then, pow! Another hit of vanilla and coffee rings across my tongue. Alcohol is more apparent as the sip goes down. A long aftertaste coats the palate and lasts forever. Beautiful tobacco and caramel flavor develop slowly.

This beer is mysterious. A little more complex than the regular Pannepot, more pungent but less in control of itself, especially as it ends. The nose is spectacular though, and it is a remarkable brew overall. Can¬ít thank Urbain and Carlo enough!
(bottle 09/06-2012) 2008 vintage, low beige head, dark red color, soft co2, complex taste, strong malty taste, wine ¬íish taste.
Hade v√§ldigt h√∂ga f√∂rv√§ntningar. Doft och smak av tr√§, n√∂tter, b√§r, s√∂t karamell, malt. Len och s√∂t i gommen.

UPDATED: JUL 13, 2012 Struise Pannepot reserva ¬í07

A - 3 finger off white carb. Pitch black. SRM of 65? Hard to tell dark bear.

S - French oak, slight bourbon notes. Candy corns. Brown sugar and vanilla. Smells close to BCBS vanilla. Not fully though. Bourbon is very big.

T - Wow. Yeah. Big boozy taste. Hasn¬ít faded after so many years. Candy corns and sweet candies. Ice cream and flat Pepsi. I¬ím getting a hint of mocha. The tongue tingling booze is very special.

M - 70% carbonation. Heavy body. Boozy whiskey finish.

O - Wow. 100 a+. Holy crap. I have an ¬í05 and ¬í09-10 of this. Can¬ít wait to try these at home. The ¬í07 was remarkable!

UPDATE: ¬í05 Vintage had at home. 375ML (37.5CL) format in a Chimay Chalice. 

half a finger, coffee coloured head. Still pitch black. Big mocha, nice hint of vanilla. Candy Corn and yeah, flat pepsi. Amazing that I still get those same scents. Taste: Actually, the ¬í05 I have has a bit metallic taste. The ¬í07 I had didn¬ít have this AT ALL. Finish is still the same as before with mocha, caramel, oak and vanilla. Mouthfeel is slightly less with the 2 years of time + oxidation having an effect on it. Overall: Wow. Still an absolutely amazing beer! One of THE best beers I¬íve ever had. I continue to stand on the 4.7 rating yet, I bump it up to 4.8. The ¬í05 is different as in it¬ís a bit more mellow and more enjoyable to drink than the ¬í07 BUT I¬ím glad I didn¬ít sit on it any longer. ¬í07 was great and the ¬í05 was perfect but it has less edge than the ¬í07. Certainly falling off at this point.

Pour out of 11.2 oz bottle, dark brownish black pour with nice fluffy tan head, aroma has notes of big candi sugar, apple brandy notes, oak, vanilla, big raisin, fig, tart fruits, caramel, molasses, more brandy and apple notes.  Taste is big tart apple, dark fruits, brandy, port notes, some slight nutty, dark chocolate, some hints of slight raisin, figs, finishing sweet but dry.  Yum.

Dop o la Pannepot, la Pannepot reserve, finalmente riesco ad assaggiare
la Gran Reserve. Di colore nero con schiuma nocciola abbastanza persistente. Il gusto e di caff√®, nocciola e cioccolato e anche un leggero profumo di vaniglia. Il gusto rispecchia gli odori e nonostante i 10¬∞ gradi la birra e ben equilibrata.  Ottima

UPDATED: MAY 13, 2012 The Reserva bottles are a noticeable step up over an already tremendous beer. One of my favorate beers on the planet! Deep, dark and complex. Wonderfully rich dark fruit flavors. Raisin. Date. Candied orange peel. Spice cake. Big barrel flavors. Body, aroma and taste continue to build as it warms. Each year tastes slightly different, but all are fantastic!!!

2005 bottle.  Pours a dark murky brown with a very thin tan head.  Aroma of sweet apple, fig, raisin, sweet malt, and light roasted/charred malt.  Flavor is sweet upfront and quite malty with sweet fruits, date, fruitcake, and raisin as well.  Tasty, and though it is quite aged, it is holding up well.
7/4/8/4/14 [3.7/5]

33 cl bottle vintage 2008, BBE 16.08.2016
Blind tasting @ lusikka
Dark ruby colour ¬ñ looks like a berry juice. Aroma is sourish with oaky notes and sour cherries. Also a bit ¬íwatery¬í. Flavour is tart, sour and somewhat sweet with oaky notes and sour cherries. It seems that I am still not a friend of these oud bruin -style ales. My guess was Rodenbach Grand Cru.

330 ml bottle. 2008 vintage. Batch no. 4. BBE 16.08.2016.
Pours a deep brown colour with a beigeish head. Aroma of strong ripe fruits, sweet berries, wood, some sour notes too. Delicious flavour. Flavour of slightly toasted malts, strong ripe fruits, wood, nuts, sweet berries and strong sticky caramel. Full bodied, thick mouthfeel and a warming, oaky, and sweet finish. A bit too much oakiness in the finish. A delicious nectar, which would improve by age even more.

Bottle @ √òrsted √òlbar. Vintage 2008. Hazy dark reddish brown with a lasting light brown head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, dried fruit, yeasty, wood, a little vanilla and a little alcohol. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet finish with warming alcohol. Smooth. 250412

2008 vintage. Pours deep dark mahogany with virtually no head. Sweet raisin aroma, notes of nuts and coffee. Rich, malty flavour with coffee, caramel, burnt notes, oak and fruit. Round, smooth. Excellent beer.

A - pours deep mahogany red with no head. S - aromas of dough, dark fruit. Hints of malts and brown sugar. M - heavy bodied brew with light alcohol warming. Full palate. Lingering alcohol warmed brown sugar. T - dark dried fruits, Belgian yeast, brown sugar on the nose. Maple syrup, chocolate, dark malts on the palate. Lingering alcohol warmed end. O - good dark Belgian. 7/7+

2008, 330 ml bottle via Beer Planet. Pours a dark brown with light tan head. Hints of dark chocolate and malts to the nose. Flavors of burnt caramel, dark chocolate, bitter nuts, oak (acidic), and licorice. Definite presence of alcohol. Not as impressive as the 2008 Reserva, but still a very good beer.

Can¬ít remember where I bought it, but it was a while ago and it has been aging nicely/going off in my cellar/cupboard. Slow burner on opening, but was pretty lively and soon overflowed. Dark brown/very dark red colour with gold bubbly head. Aroma is lots of dark fruits, sweet booze, slightly herbal. Not as full on as expected. Maybe the age has faded it, but smells lovely and subtle. Taste is lovely too. Caramel creamy, lots of fruit again. Sort of get the calvados apple booziness coming up towards the end. Finish is sweet, black treacly and long lasting. Touch of spice and liquorice too. Quite thick and full bodied. Really nice.

Caramel and candi sugar in the nose. Light, thin brown color. Candi sugar sweetness. Flavors are mellowed with age. Thin-medium body. Smooth mouth feel. A pleasant, gentle beer. It is probably a few years past its best.

UPDATED: APR 4, 2015 Bouteille de 33cl de 2008. Robe tr√®s sombre , presque opaque, mousse moyenne qui s¬íestompe en consevant une collerette. Une bi√®re cors√©e, m√ªre qui se boit tr√®s bien. Du pruneaux, du caramel et des ar√¥mes bois√©s ainsi qu¬íun bel √©quilibre sucre amertume. La texture est un peu sirupeuse, belle longueur en bouche. J¬íaurais encore pu la faire vieillir (2016 d¬íapr√®s la bouteille). Trouv√©e √† Roby - Menin

Bottle shared by Maekchu. Aroma is minerals, caramel, spices. Faint nose that is not so impressive. Rich but very restrained flavors, candi sugar, roasty caramel, very spicy but not terribly fragrant or seductive as the regular Pannepot. Nice caramel malts, though. A bit too spicy. Good enough but not as exciting as I expected. Could it be past its prime?

Finally. I kept missing this in stores and trades and now I find it in Las Vegas. Surprsing pour: darker than expected but also a lighter aroma than expected. The aroma is almost porter-esque hinting at coffee and chocolate. Wow, the taste is almost too much for one bottle. Strong but not overpowering. A huge mix of flavors. Really cool beer

Deep brown with a tan head that fades relatively quickly leaving some mild lacing... slightly sweet dry fruity subdued aroma light smoke, decent aroma but not very pungent... dark fruits licorice tobacco slight tartness slight smoke choc and oak... complex... finishes a little nutty... warming full body but not overly full...

Ar: Raisins, red wine, chocolate and very dark caramel - some herbal notes, too.
Ap: Deep amber-brown - opaque - small light tan head with moderate retention.
T: Pumpernickle and nougat up front - some grainy spiciness, mixed with dark caramel and treacle - vinous with raisins toward the finish, and quite herbal with a medium-low bitterness - finish is filled with stone fruit - sweet throughout, though not cloying, with some understated oak notes.
P: Medium-full body with medium-high carbonation - finish is medium-dry.
O: Wonderfully complex and graceful Belgian strong dark ale - the beer has plentiful faces of flavor, yet the overall effect is graceful rather than overly busy and messy - just delicious.

330 mL bottle.  2005 vintage.  (Got this in a trade - I¬ím sorry, but I can¬ít remember from whom.)  Maybe should had this one a year age - there was a little oxidation, and not much carbonation.  Easy to tell that this was a great beer, though.  Still lots of dark, fried fruit, spice, candi sugar, and oak.  Body is still great.  I¬íll have to find a newer one.

330ml, 2005 bottle from West Lakeview Liquors. Pours a deep and dark, rich brown colored body with some ruby tints around the edges. Thin, fizzy, tan head that dissipates quickly and leaves a solid lacing. Aroma has a nice malty sweetness with caramel, cocoa, brown sugar, and bread as well as a rich dark fruitiness with raisins, plums, and some vinous dark fruits. There is a light wood and a touch of vanilla behind the malty dark fruits. Flavor is similar. Sweet up front with some bready caramels, brown sugar, cocoa, and molasses. More of the rich dark fruits with raisins and plums as well as some brandy. Fruits get a bit vinous towards the end as a light oak and spicing comes in as this finishes with a peppery dark fruit, sweet malts, light oak, and a slight alcohol kick that helps dry this a bit with the oak and spice before leaving a fairly lengthy aftertaste. Creamy, pretty full body and a slightly lively, soft, moderate carbonation. Overall, a pretty complex and fairly delicate beer for the high ABV%. Sweeter and rich with a solid malt and vinous dark fruit backing with a peppery, slightly oaky, light alcohol kick in the finish to balance. I loved the original Pannepot and rated it much higher than this one, but I still really enjoyed this beer. Well put together.

2005 Bottle; Pour is murky dark brown with a fine bubbled khaki head in this tulip; retention is modest, with some light lacing as well. The nose is similar to the reserva, albeit... less sugary. Dark fruits, oak treatment, brown sugar, and caramel. The flavor profile has a cola feel to it ; more dark fruits, plums, caramel, brown sugar, oak treatment... it has a more refined feel to it than the reserva. This is certainly true, having had them side by side. I think that the standard is still my slight favorite, though.

13/02/2012 Bir&Fud Bottega (Vintage 2005). Nera, riflessi color marrone, schiuma cappuccino, non molto abbondante, poco persistente. Aroma di mele, vaniglia, frutta secca, alcol. In bocca caramello, zucchero di canna, ancora mela, leggero tostato, liquorosa, leggermente stucchevole alla lunga. Corpo medio, carbonazione soft. Rispetto alla Reserva sembra pi√π dolce e docile. Inferiore alle attese.

2008 bottle very dark brown with a large tanned head. aroma is sweet, chocolate, raisin, dark brown sugar, some wine notes. taste is smooth and sweet with apple brandy. complex, spicy, with restrained (coffee) bitterness. cherries, chocolate and calvados oak are abundant. At a push, i¬íd take the standard pannepot for its smoother profile, but this is still fantastic (probably better than the reserva).
Very nice.  The oak aging process accentuates the prominent dark fruit and caramel malty flavor.  Pours dark with a tan head.  Oh, and plum.  Of course plum.
Delicious beer! Extraordinary balance of sweet, spice and alcohol with a soft yet powered palate. It¬ís complexity is an unique experience!
2005.  Molasses sweetness, some raisin.  Direct.  Ruby brown, small eggshell head.  Blackberry and amber honey, firm toasty body.  Juicy in the finish with plum.

2006. Very nice caramel and fig sweetness, hazy brown color. It feels just a little flabby like its starting on the downslope for its age. Either drink them all now or let them sit another 20 years and see if some special magic happens.
UPDATED: MAR 16, 2013 Cerveza oscura, con aroma a fruta madura y vainilla. Sabor intenso a caramelo, frutas pasas y malta todo matizado por la madera.

2005 Vintage, Rating #1400 
Tasted on 3/16/12 from a 330mL bottle obtained in a trade.  Pours dark cola brown with an average tan head that slowly recedes to thin lace.  The nose is not overpowering, but subtly complex, with candi and brown sugar, date and fig, molasses, caramel, some vanilla oak, and just a touch of the apple brandy sweetness.  The flavor is features the vanilla, caramel, brown sugar, and apple brandy prominently up front, moving to some nice bitterness and the dark fruits and tannin on the finish.  The body is full with an oily texture, light carbonation, and a long, lightly bitter and oaky apple brandy finish.
330ml bottle, very sweet aroma, dark fruits, cherry and current. This is extremly well done... Delicious beer.

Pours dark brown bordering on black with a thin off white head. Nose is cedar, chocolate, pepper and still some alcohol notes. Flavor is sweet mostly until the finish where bitter enters but does not overpower the sweet. Mouthfeel is orgasmic. Soft and creamy no harshness whatsoever. Long drawn out aftertaste. Perfection. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

¬í05, poured into Ommegang tasting glass. Smells sweet and a bit like stale banana bread with hints of clove and roasted undertones. Some alcohol on the nose. Body is hazy and the color of dates with a thin beige head. Tastes sweet with a clear Calvados barrel influence, slightly fruity with a touch of wood and definite spice presence. Heavy on the tongue, leaves a bit of residue with each sip. I don¬ít know if I enjoy this one as old as it is. I might prefer the regular Pannepot Reserva a bit better.

Poured into an Ommegang tulip.  Coca-Cola brown body with about a fingers worth of off-white head.  The nose has some unidentifiable Belgian spice, plums, cherries and oak notes.  Hints of chocolate, but also slightly stale.  The flavor consists of vanilla, oak, chocolate and a hint of cherry.  Again, some spices mingle in the background, but they are hard to identify.  Some oxidation.  The complexity of this beer almost seems somewhat muted at this age.  Body has some nice weight, with small, light, carbonation.  10% abv is well hidden.  Overall, a pretty good beer.  Seems a bit stale and oxidized.  I remember this being better when I had it a year or two ago.  Probably not aging for the better.

Bottle @ Timbers, Denver. Pours dark brown with a small light tan head. Aroma of malts, caramel, dark fruits, vanilla, oak, nuts, sugar, port. Taste is sweet malt, caramel, candy, dark fruit, raisins and plums, oak, light spices, sweet port, very complex. Medium body, soft carbonation, alcohol very well hidden, lasting sweet fruity, light spicy finish. 010312
330 ml bottle a dark brown black colored beer with a beige head aroma malts caramel vanilla brown sugar dark fruits spicy and oak flavor malts caramel vanilla dark fruit warm alcohol spicy and oak

2005 vintage. 11.2 oz. bottle, pours a murky dark reddish brownwith a small beige head. Aroma of oak, vanilla, dark fruits, molasses and a stronger vinous note compare to the regular Reserva. Flavour of oak, vanilla, dark fruits, toffee and some vinous notes. Full-bodied and complex, slightly eclipsing the Reserva, though the flavours die slightly sooner. Marginally superior to the Reserva - excellence.

Poured into a goblet. 2008 vintage.

3.5 A: Pours a ruddy brown color. Barely half a fingers of frothy light brown head. Retention isn¬ít all that great either, but the ABV is up there. No lacing.

4.0 S: Strong green apple presence alongside candied plum, fig, and date. Vanilla with some oak, caramel, toasted malts, and a light nuttiness. Peppery spiciness. It¬ís very nice, but everything about it is subtle.

4.0 T: Taste is like the nose for the most part. Candied dark fruits, green and red apple, vanilla and oak. Caramel, toasted malt, nuts. Pepper fromt the yeast. Here¬ís the thing about this though. There¬ís an almost "biting" woody aspect in here. It¬ís not present in the normal Pannepot, so I assume it¬ís from the Calvados. It¬ís not a bad flavor, but it is a dominant one that doesn¬ít fit in with the rest of the beer. Either way, still tasty.

3.5 M: Lighter medium body. This could use a bit more carbonation and it would be better if it were spritzier. Could use a touch more creaminess too.

4.0 D: Good beer, but I can¬ít say that I think all the extra stuff has made the regular any better.

Serving type: bottle

Bottle 2008 vintage @ home. Black, brown colour with a good sized, tanned head. Aroma of oak, licorice, coffee and roast malts. Flavour is roasty, fruity and sweet. Nice dry, sticky mouthfeel, eventually my glass was sticky around the spot where I drank from. Really sugary, kandi sugar and woody. Nice in balance. Took me over an hour to finish the bottle, which is a good thing in this case. Great beer!!

Draft, 2005.  Cola black body, small beige head.  Aroma is moderately sweet, vinous, molasses, caramel.  Taste is moderately sweet, raisin, some alcohol, light prune.  Sticky medium-full body, low carbonation.

#1252 bottle (vintage 2008); Nose is tobacco, oak, sweat alcohol, mushroom, later caramel, malt and weak marcipan, feel Is mediumfat, carb is quite low, taste Is roasted malt, caramel, some cake, red berries, velvet alcohol, later some earth
Sample pour @ Max¬ís Belgian beer fest. Mostly noting to say ive had it............................................

2006 vintage, so says the bottle. Opaque, almost black pour. Small khaki head, minimal lacing. Beautiful smell of roasted malt, molasses, dried dark fruit. Same in the taste with a bigger vanilla molasses-ness. A little bit of bitterness. A slight roasted coffee flavor mixed with brown sugar. Awesome beer.

Tap. Pours dark brown with average white head; short retention and spare lacing. Aroma is dark fruit, sour notes, caramel malt, leather, and earthy notes. Flavor is average malt and esters with light hops; dark fruit finish. Medium body and warmth with low carbonation.

Shared bottle from Ol Beer in Walnut Creek, CA. This bottle was aged to perfection. Smelled of dark fruits and molasses. Upon first taste the first thing I thought of was Fig Newton¬ís. Very well done beer.

33cl bottle from 2008. Almost point black with small tanned head. Nose : Dried fruits and cherry esters. Coffee like roasted malts. Wood resin. Sip : The density is medium with oily feeling. Sweet with aromas of dried fruits ending with dry coffee like feeling. The overall balance is transition of delicate and fine layers. Nice beer but somehow I had more fun with a regular Pannepot. Maybe the texture was more "cool" .

Bottle 33 cl. Pours beautiful black brown with ruby tones, great creamy dark tanned head leaving nice lace. Aroma is malty, a bit sour, oak barrel, a bit sweet and caramel, spicy and belgo yeast. Flavor is fullbodied, sweet, malty, pungent, yeasty, very nice Belgo touch, peppery, fruity, great bitterness and oak barrel. Finishes with a longlived bitter and malty aftertaste.

33cl bottle, 2005 vintage, 02/02/2012.  Pours deep brown, opaque, with thin, quickly fading head.  Nose carries dark honey, apple plum, vanilla caramel, spicy oak finish.  Taste carries dark fruits, plums evident, slight tartness, caramel, some spices near the end, bit of roast and nice barrel presence in the finish.  Palate is medium thin, but coating, and smooth.  Me favorite treatment of Pannepot- though the spiciness is a bit muted,  I love how the Calvados treatment shines through, adding a bit of sweet tartness.  
Note:  Also tried a 75cl bottle last night of same vintage, and it was clearly going south and a bit sour- maybe best to move on to newer vintages here.

2005 Bottle picked up at Binny¬ís, I think. Pours the typical deep brown with a persistent fluffy head. The nose is a punch of vanilla, light fruity esters and a slight tartness. The barrel is really quite prominent here. Spicy phenols persist as well. On tasting, an appley note with more booze than I¬íd like. Lots of the good Pannepot character, strong phenolics, alcohol & vanilla come through. Definitely interesting and with a bit less booze it would be superd.

UPDATED: APR 30, 2012 
33 cl bottle @ lusikkas¬í blind tasting.
Rating 8-4-8-4-16.
Murky brown color with small off-white head. Aroma of sour ripe fruits, spices and sweet malts. Flavor is pretty much the same with some chocolaty notes added. Some oakiness present also. Complex brew with well hidden alcohol.
4436
33 cl bottle.
Rated on 20100507.
Dark brown color. Strong aroma of spices, caramel malts and ripe fruits. Flavor of ripe fruits, plum, liquorice notes, caramel and spice notes. Very complex and flavorful.

Dark cola color pour with small tan head. Aroma of malt, red fruit, red wine and slighty oaky. Taste is ripe fruit, red wine, green apple and slightly oaky. Nice mouthfeel with the perfect carbonation and a slight tartiness present. Excellent and very enjoyable beer.

Sweet vinous aroma. Oak and mild fruit. Beer pours opaque brown with a thin head. Surprised at how smooth this beer is. Brown and toasted malt flavor balanced with fruit and wine. Finish is very nice with just a touch of oak.

Excuse me:

1. This is my first review here
2. My poor English.

Tasted in the end of 2010: almost black. Discreet, harmonious nose - lots of malt, a bit of citrus,  notes of cedarwood. On the palate there¬ís a great interplay between malt and citrus notes. Rich in content and kind of refreshing - both at the same time! I love this slightly sour notes. Not too many roasted flavours; small notes of wood and vanilla. Great complexity. Absolutely adorable beer. Very long finish with a fine sweet/sour/bitter balance. Close to perfection. One of those beers, that show more on the palate that on the nose. One of the best beers ¬ítill now - even better then Pannepot and Pannepot Reserva. ¬ñ ¬ñ Ende 2010 getrunken: beinahe schwarz. Verhaltene, harmonische Nase - viel Malz, etwas Zitrus, Zedernholznoten.
